title: The little things are big...
body: After YouFood ended, I was lost. I loved taking pics of my food to keep a journal, but at some point, I realized that habitually taking the photo just became habit and I always wished for more.  So far, it seems that “Ate” has it.  First, as simple s concept as it is, I love, love, love the on and off path option. Actively saying that I am “on path” is an motivator😇 that I did not anticipate. Likewise, who wants to admit that they’re “off path” 🤷🏽‍♀️? I also love the integration of my water and exercise efforts as well. I’ve only been doing it for three days, so I haven’t really gotten into all of the other benefits but I also like the idea of tracking why I eat, whether I eat at home or out, how the meal was prepared, how I was feeling when I ate and a big one...who I ate with 😉!  I have a feeling that in time, I’m going to see some real trends that will expose for me why I eat the way I eat and more importantly how much I eat. Aside from always saying “I just love food”, that’s a question that I don’t think I’ve truly figured out just yet.  Now, I just need to find some friends for more accountability.  I’m trying the upgrade and had marked my calendar to cancel after 14 days, planning to be unfulfilled, but I know already that I’m in.  Yearly plan paid for.  Wish me luck!  P.S.  I swear I’m not a developer or a friend or family member of theirs and I can prove it.  Just try it and see for yourself!  😂😂

title: Most useful and efficient food tracking
body: I’ve tried myfitnesspal calorie counting, daily photo journals, and also just writing out the food but the interface of this app is aesthetically pleasing and visually appealing as well as directed. The option to chose “off path” or “on path” with the reminder of what your current goal is at the top of the screen is brilliantly simple and helps me to minimize obsessive food thoughts like “I ate so bad I’m so fat” or “i ate an apple today so that makes up for the ice cream and chips and cookies I ate the rest of the day” etc etc. It even lets you make a collage of your food pictures at the end of the day, which is a perfect way to visualize what you’re putting into your body. Oh, and you can track calories in the comments under your picture but you can also track where you ate, if you ate alone or with people, why you ate, and how it made you feel which is a genius way to help people make the lifestyle change into eating healthier (instead of forcing yourself to eat ‘healthy’ foods you despise you can focus on the healthy foods you adore). I’ve been searching for an app like this for years and I’m very happy I’ve finally come across it. I hope to use it for a while, and I really appreciate that it’s a free app with no ads. Hands down my favorite health app.

title: So far, so good!
body: I’ve been using ate for about a week, and there are several things I love about it:

title: Great app and great management!
body: I have never reviewed an app before, so that tells you something right off the bat. I have loved the ease in this app. Meal tracking has always stressed me out. I hate measuring things. My meals are too elaborate to traditionally track. Being able to snap a picture (which I usually already do anyways😂 #foodblog) and add a description makes “tracking” so much easier! I’m able to share this app with my nutritionist and she can have an idea of what I am eating in a day without me having to track. The summary questions have allowed me to have a much better relationship with my meals, realizing trends and habits that I may not have realized before. It forces me to slow down and ask myself these important questions. I love it.

title: Great app
body: I have been using this app for maybe a week or so. Before finding Ate, I tested multiple fasting apps and nothing worked well or was set up good. I don’t even think I want to fast for the reasons on other apps. This app is GREAT. I’ve always taken pictures of my food and saved them, especially when I cook a meal or fix a healthy breakfast for example. Ate allows me to see what I eat in a day and it lets me record how it made me feel (I LOVE this part of the app because I struggle with how food makes me feel). I also love that it adds options such as “who did you eat with?” and “where did you eat?” Overall this app seems perfect for me and I hope I continue to use this to track my food habits.

title: Only been using for a week and it has done wonders
body: I was looking for an alternative to calorie and macro counting. After listening to a podcast that focuses heavily on mental aspects of weight loss I thought to myself it would be awesome if I could just snap photos of my food for myself to stay accountable. I began searching the app store for such a thing as a “visual diary” and ran into Ate.

title: Exactly what I was looking for!
body: I love this app! I wanted a food diary thing, but don’t want to track calories or even type in every teaspoon of oil I use to cook my dinner. I love that I can quickly type something in, and the photo aspect is unexpectedly great! It’s quick to snap a picture and it motivates me to add things like fruit and vegetables to my plate since I’m visually more apt to notice that I’m skipping them and just eating a sandwich or a piece of toast. I also like the freedom to change what is “on path” for me - since it’s not specific to one type of eating. I really love the little arrow that encourages me to make a healthier choice for my next meal if I do go off path - it’s not judgy and unlike other things I’ve tried, I don’t tend to feel like I’ve “ruined” a day with one meal or food, so I’m more likely to just move on and eat something that is better for me at the next meal rather than derail and start again the next day (or week or whatever!). Thanks for such a helpful tool!

title: Super helpful and easy to use!
body: I’ve been using ate for the past week with a group of friends in an effort to take better care of our bodies this year and practice more mindfulness with our eating.  The benefits are already so evident.  Having to actually document what, when, and how much you are eating really makes me think twice before eating too much or eating things that aren’t as good for me, which are 2 big goals for me.  Also, because my friends and I follow each other on the app, it’s actually EXCITING to take a picture of my home-cooked, healthy meals or any other instances where I’m making good food choices!  I have also loved tracking how eating made me feel, which is one of the questions the app asks you after your meal.  Tracking my meals is quick and easy, which is important to me, and I’m going to keep using ate!  Highly recommend if you’re like me and struggle sometimes with being mindful with your eating!

title: Best app I’ve ever used
body: After decades of trying to understand and heal my GI issues, I finally decided I needed to get better at keeping a food journal and tracking how different foods make me feel. A Google search brought up Ate— since it was free and so well reviewed, I downloaded it immediately. I’ve been hooked ever since.

title: Fantastic and amazing!!!
body: This is only my second day using the app but it has brought me such peace and joy.  Taking photos of my meals felt strange to me at first but what I realized is that it really promotes mindfulness and reflection.  You can make notes that go along with the picture, creating a new kind of ritual practice that slows down your meal nicely and easily.  I like all the tracking in terms of hunger level, satisfaction, etc.  But perhaps my favorite thing of all are the “experiments” you get to try.  The one I chose to start with is to take 2 deep breaths before eating.  Even that simple act allows me to connect to my body and spirit so that I can listen to my physical and emotional needs.  My lifelong struggle with stress eating has been exasperated due to the COVID-19 situation.  I didn’t want to spiral back down into the overeating so I found this app. I couldn’t be happier, calmer, or feeling more grounded around food.  Thank you to the creators and developers!!!

title: Perfect for my needs
body: I have downloaded every meal tracker app available on the App Store it seems, but nothing was exactly what I was looking for in till I found ate. I just need a simple place where I can write down or take a picture of what I’m eating, which is enough to keep me “on path” without the stress of calorie counting, trying to search a weird database for what I ate, entering the exact quantities of what I ate, or having to report to a health coach. The design of this app is pleasing, it’s easy to use, I like the questions they ask you after your meal so you can reflect on whether you made a good choice or not and why. I’m grateful to the makers of this app for understanding that not everybody wants to spend their entire life counting calories, even if we still want to be healthy. Thank you! I am strongly considering a subscription, but the free version has everything that I really need, so don’t let that scare you off from downloading it :)

title: The only food tracking app I have consistently used with success
body: This app is a game changer and I’m so happy I found it. I have struggled with binge eating and an unhealthy relationship with food for the better part of my life. The app is like a picture food journal that lets me track what I eat and the emotions that go along with it. In turn my entire perspective on eating has changed and I have developed a healthy and mindful eating pattern. If you are struggling with disordered eating this is the app you’re looking for. Even if you’re just trying to loose weight and be mindful of what you eat THIS IS THE APP YOU'RE LOOKING FOR. I have tried other food tracking apps and they don’t compare to this one. It’s super helpful too that they give you a day “recap” where you can see what you ate and what you were feeling/why you ate at the time. This will help anyone’s fitness journey. 😊

title: Total Game Changer! 👍🏽👍🏽
body: This app has become a cherished part of my every meal. It helps me to be mindful of the food choices I make by gently reminding to put as much thought in my choice of food as I would my choice of clothing for the day. I am so proud of myself when I hit that “On Path” button, it’s motivation in itself to make healthier choices. But even when I do go “Off Path”, this app obliterates the usual shame and guilt I would normally feel and helps me treat myself better.

title: Best app I’ve used
body: I have used numerous apps of this kind and I’ve determined that I cannot stand counting calories. It’s draining and it gives me bad anxiety. I honestly believe that counting calories can trigger eating disorders for some.

title: Simple in all the right ways
body: I heard about this app from a nutrition coach who uses it with some of her clients. I struggle to use food diaries because I am on the go constantly at work, frequently eating two meals at the office, often with colleagues around, and often I can’t prepare them. So the idea that I can stop, write down a bunch of stuff, look up its nutritional values, etc, has never worked. Enter Ate. You can snap a picture of your food with two clicks (one to open the app, one to shoot), and it’s already at an appropriate angle to capture your plate so it’s very discreet too. Then click once more for whether it’s on or off your “path” and you’re done. You can write in things you forgot and I really like the simple questions you can answer to add detail. I haven’t used all the features yet but I am starting with being able to capture 100% of my food each day, which is a great success.

title: It’s ALL about mindful eating.
body: I’ve been using the app for about a week now.  Formerly I was using My Fitness Pal and sometimes WW.  The thing I like about the Ate app is that it totally makes you think about what you’re putting into your mouth.  You’re mindful in a way I never was with those other apps.  It also makes me feel totally in control of what I’m eating and makes me feel powerful.  I like that I’m not tied to a calorie number.  When I was tied to a number, I’d find myself eating things just because I had calories “left” in the day.  Now, I’m more likely to focus on whether I’m actually hungry or not.   That’s sort of the key and the hardest thing for most of us that struggle with weight.  If we could just stop eating as soon as we aren’t hungry anymore, then no one would be overweight.   That thought is life changing but very difficult to actually do when a donut is staring you in the face!

title: Motivating!
body: I have only been using this app for one week, but I love it so far!This app is so motivational! I have set a path to focus on eating small healthy meals throughout the day- choosing a variety of veggies,fruits and healthy protein! I love how easy it is to snap a picture to log my eating. I can easily see what and how often I ate throughout the day. Stopping to take a photo before I eat something really makes me more thoughtful about what I put in my body. I have also loved plating  my food to make a “pretty” picture - instead of snacking out of a bag, I take the time to plate my snacks now! It’s actually fun! I love the questions that are asked after eating- I have really focused now on eating at a table not on the couch or in the car.  I rarely eat with my phone or while watching TV, I enjoy my food and listen to my body more when I feel satisfied- rather than stuffed or the bowl is empty!

title: THANK YOU 🙌
body: I used to use myfitness pal like it was my job. I developed a horrible eating disorder as I constantly was concerned about exactly how many calories I put in my body and terrified if I couldn’t track it. This app is a lifesaver.

title: Love the simplicity!
body: I have wished for a long time for an app that would give me a way to track my food without listing individual ingredients or requiring calorie counts before meals could be logged. I am so glad to have found the Ate app! The design is brilliant and as easy as it gets. I appreciate the questions to answer after each meal, especially the two, “Why did you eat?” and “How did it make you feel?” That has been an interesting exercise for me to think about after eating, and helpful for changing some of my habits. I also appreciate how easy it is to scroll back through the past days/weeks to look over what I was eating and be able to see how my meals are changing over time. I find it incredibly motivating. I have tried multiple apps for food tracking, and always gradually dropped off from using them. But, with the simplicity of this one, I expect to be using it years from now.

title: Almost Perfect Food Journal!
body: It’s a really fantastic app, there’s a lot I like about it - for example it uses data from your camera roll to date your food inputs if you upload photos that way, but you can still easily change the date and time of meal inputs manually if need be. I also like the “recap” function for seeing my daily progress all in one place. LOVE that it tracks my fasts between days too.

title: Down 17lbs and counting
body: This app is amazing. I’m someone who has tried EVERY diet and fitness app out there and nothing has been as effective as this app. I’ve lost 17lbs since I started using the app a little over a month ago and I’m still losing. The best part is you can customize your goals for you, you aren’t forced to eat or not eat any foods. I’m still eating whatever I want, but the mindfulness questions for every meal are helping me realize what foods make me feel good. If I get off track of the path I created for myself, it isn’t the end of the world and I don’t binge on ice cream like I would with other diets. I just try to be more mindful during the next meal. Mindfulness really is key to being able to make smart choices in any situation, and I’m so grateful for this app! THANK YOU FOR YOUATE, DEVELOPERS! It really works!

title: Love this visual food diary app!
body: This app is a fantastic way for you to keep track of what you’re eating in the most non-judgmental way possible. No calorie counting, no need to give excessive amount of information concerning the ingredients of what you’re eating, just a simple picture and you’re done. The on/off path feature is a great way to hold yourself accountable without shame. Once you take a picture you can click on it and fill out information of where you’re eating and how you’re feeling, among other questions. Only thing I would ask for is that you can add more words in this section. Sometimes I eat when I’m anxious but it doesn’t mean I’m stressed. But it’s a minor thing. I truly love this app and I really appreciate how mindful it’s made me when it comes to my meals.

title: Awesome! LOVE this app!
body: I’ve always hated logging what I eat because it’s too tedious, time consuming & detailed. But YouAte makes it so quick & easy. All you have to do is snap a quick pic. Even if you don’t enter it that moment you can go back whenever, import the pic & it will automatically enter the time you took the pic. I love the reflection questions as well that help you think more about why and how you’re eating. It also has a pie graph to show you how much of your eating is for what reasons & it keeps great stats on how much time you go between meals. The layout is simple and attractive. This app makes food journaling/logging/tracking so much fun! You can even share it with friends to keep each other accountable & encourage friends in eating better! LOVE that! Everyone should be using this app!

title: Aid to mindful eating
body: I’ve tried zillions of diets and apps over the years, losing weight fast or slow, but usually gaining it back. I’m convinced that the only way to achieve and maintain a healthy weight is by being mindful of what you’re eating, how much you’re eating, and when you’re eating.

title: Easy App
body: This app is working for me. I really needed a break from the journaling world, but didn’t want to just stop paying attention to what I was eating. This app is the perfect answer. If you know how to snap a pic, then you can use this app. I love the freedom I feel when I prepare my meal and don’t have to break down every. Single. Ingredient.

title: Perfect Balance
body: I’ve tried every diet on the planet. I used to think it was fun tracking my macros. In the end it’s nothing but a obsession & for  WHAT? Possibly losing a couple pounds, weighing & measuring everything only to eat dinner at a friends house & blow the whole thing. Let’s face it that’s no fun. So I tried keto no thanks, next OMAD with no restrictions that was the best so far however I found myself overeating & hungry by mid afternoon & obsessing over dinner. I’m one of those people who like to try different ways to eat and I have a love- hate relationship with tracking it. I found this app & I'm still intermittent fasting using a more intuitive approach & making my first afternoon meal smaller then I can have a normal size dinner & I’m not starving. Taking pictures is perfect because I can get a visual which honestly is more than sufficient to see how I’m doing. This app is Awesome!!

title: Finally!
body: I really love this app. I needed a way to watch and be aware of my eating that didn’t make me feel restricted, guilty, controlled or so seriously eating disordered that I became paralyzed and consumed by fear. I know what to do, but totally resist being “ told” or managed by someone else. This app lets me choose MY path and focus on what I know I want to work on. There is no frowny face or judgement when I wobble... just a little jog in my path. Photographing my meals instead of entering what I ate one by one on a list totally works for me and gives me a visual way to see if I ate enough color during the day. There is no target other than on path or off,  and a percentage that I can improve on tomorrow. When I’m at a loss for what to eat, I’ve got a whole gallery of previous meals I can refer to. Thanks for making my food life easier!

title: ate (8) out of five stars 😉
body: This is one of my all-time favorite apps. Instead of tracking calories, taking pictures has made it so much easier to think about why and how I am eating. It makes me more likely to eat because I’m hungry, than eat because I have calories left for the day. The creators of ate have obviously put so much thought into designing this app, and it shows! I love looking back at pictures of what I ate in previous days (and I like making my plates look pretty too!). The graphs of how you have been eating are so helpful, and they have every kind of graph that I could want to see. I talked my mother into doing it with me, and it’s been a blast to see what she’s eating from her point of view. Thank you so much for this app, developers! I would highly recommend it. 🍏

title: Great app!
body: I am enjoying being able to see the daily recap, *in living color* photos of what all I eat in a day, and how it fits into my goal of eating more veggies, and thus just more healthy eating. The mindful eating concept is especially so important for those of us still working remotely, and who have a well stocked kitchen just a few steps away :) Making wiser choices, and being aware of timing as well, are so important!

title: Great for binge eaters
body: I love this app! I had fitness pal and other calorie counting apps but I will always forget to record what I ate. Taking the pic before each meal it’s so much easier to remember. Not only that it helps me to see how much I’ve been eating I love that I can scroll and see if I had sugar that week and it gets you to the root of your problem. So every time you snap a pic you can add tags of how that meal made you feel and the app creates pie graph of why you eat. I also like that it gives you the time in between each meal perfect if this is important for your type of diet like a fasting diet. So there is no way to track calories and I don’t mind bucease for me now portion control is what i need so this works great I want to upgrade but i don’t know if is it worth it. But i love it so far

title: Painless (and fun!) awareness
body: I downloaded this app instead of going to calorie counting or a fad diet (both of which I was considering). It’s been wonderful! I can easily snap a photo of my meals and there’s a fun and encouraging component to getting to capture my choices. It makes me want to make BETTER choices. You get to retroactively log why you ate, where you ate and how you felt which has given me an overall better awareness of my eating habits and I’ve since been able to cut back eating when I’m bored and not hungry. It’s helps promote self compassion because you can always get back on path if you choose an off path meal or snack. Lastly, I get to see my stats week to week, like how “on path” I’ve been towards the goals I got to set and how much time I usually go between meals.

title: So lovely and effortless.
body: First off, no calorie counting! That’s the main reason I appreciate this app. In my experience, counting calories doesn’t work. I forget all about what a “meal” is and don’t think about what I want. But with this app, I get to be simple, crate meals I will enjoy and even make them presentable since I know I’m going to take a photo for my journal. Also, it really has a beautiful interface! I love the color scheme. What’s nice is the app encourages you to decide for yourself whether your “on path” or “off path” and to evaluate you reasons for eating each meal, how you feel, and how the food was. Just a simple and helpful way to watch what you eat without obsessing over calories. I am glad they made YouAte! Thanks you guys!

title: Healing my relationship with foid
body: This app is a fantastic way to set healthy food goals and have accountability without counting calories or becoming obsessive with weight. Ive had some emotional and mental issues surrounding weight and eating and this app is allowing me to track my food for my nutritionist without negatively impacting my sense of self worth. It also really has helped me stop judging when I go “off path”. It takes away a lot if the shame about eating unhealthy food bc I can see it as being “off path” instead of “I am bad for eating this”.

title: This app changed everything for me!
body: Such a simple concept. That we don’t need to count calories to lose weight. That by simply looking at photos of what we’ve eaten, we can instantly tell if we’ve eaten too much or just enough, and if what we’re eating consists of nutrition-packed calories or empty calories. I’ve lost 9 pounds so far, am absolutely not on a diet, do not feel deprived, and have never eaten better! Having to take a picture of everything I eat greatly encourages me to choose colorful, healthy options, pay more attention to portion sizes, and to think twice about whether I really want to eat something. It’s also very reinforcing to look back at my food choices and feel proud of them. I love this app!

title: Love this easy to use app
body: This is app is wonderful! It’s so easy to use, all you do is take a picture or type in what you ate, say if its on path or not, then say how it made you feel! I like that i can see how my day went and that I don’t have to count calories. I’ve tried a lot of different food tracking apps and most are complicated to keep track of everything. This makes me feel like I’m in control and I don’t let a silly number of calories I’m allowed a day control me. Seeing that I ate something good for me makes me want to eat something healthy again, if i ate something not so good then i know at my next meal to step it up and make it a good choice! I would like to see more options under how did it make you feel.

title: What a relief!
body: I’ve been on one diet or another since I was a teenager, losing and regaining the same 20 pounds over and over again. Now at age 59, I am tired of devoting so much of my precious time to counting calories and obsessing over food - always feeling guilty. This app is perfect! ATE helps me to be intentional about my eating and allows for all the reasons I might choose to eat that have nothing to do with hunger or health - and decide that’s my path - right for me. I feel as though a huge burden has lifted and I’m enjoying my life and my food. ATE is like a visual diary of my day - without a score or judgement. It’s a place that allows for curiosity and wonder and honesty rather than shame and doubt. I’m learning to trust myself with the help of this app.

title: Useful, simple, insightful
body: It’s a simple app to use, which makes it so convenient to be consistent with. Snap a picture, enjoy your meal, and come back to reflect on what you’ve eaten. Do it enough times throughout the day and at the end of the day, you can look back at everything you've eaten. It really gives you a reality check (if you’re good about photographing everything you eat) on how you eat throughout the day. It’s a great tool to have at your disposal if you’re aiming to be a more conscious eater, without the mental stress that calorie counting apps might give you. It really has you focus more on the quality of foods you eat and if those align with your food goals, rather than simply eating anything (healthy or not) as long as it meets a calorie amount at the end of the day.

title: Loving this App!
body: After trying out a few apps where you have to laboriously enter every item you eat, I found that to be to time consuming & realized I didn’t care about calories & pie charts that didn’t really seem on target.  What I really wanted was an online food journal to track what I ate daily.  Although I’ve only been using the app for a couple of weeks I’m really enjoying the ease of just snapping a pic & moving on with my day.  You can go back in & rate your meals with a Q&A section, if you choose.  If I do think about eating something unhealthy I’ve asked myself if I really want that pic in my daily recap.  It’s a small thing, but it does make you stop & think.  All in all,I’m enjoying the app &definitely plan on continuing to use it.

title: It’s just right!
body: I love the flexibility of this app! As a person who struggles with disordered eating but has other health issues that require I “watch what I eat,” this app is a perfect way to see what I’m eating and then make adjustments according to how I feel. I don’t want to count calories or measure things. I don’t need any kind of guilt layered on how much I already beat myself up. I just want to be able to look back and know what I ate. I want to collect data. I set up my goal to be “see my food” so that I’m 100% on the path all the time. Every now and then I forget the photo before I eat the food, but I’m able to just enter the text. The app is neither overly cute nor clinical. Ate passes the Goldilocks test: “it’s just right.” Thank you, Piqniq!

title: The best food tracking app
body: This is the best app I’ve used for tracking what I eat. For people recovering from an eating disorder, this app is very helpful. It promotes intuitive eating, mindfulness, and accountability. I like the photo tracking method because it makes me want to eat food that is visually appealing, like a pretty salad, instead of just eating a bag of chips or something. It also helps me track the frequency of my meals really easily and non judgmentally (some apps pressure you to eat more frequently, which is really difficult when you are in recovery). It is nice to find an eating app that has nothing to do with calories or weight. I would recommend this app to anyone who wants to track their eating in a healthy way.

title: I wish I had this years ago!
body: I’m recovering from some disordered eating issues, and counting calories is always a big no no. However I find it very difficult to eat healthy without tracking—this app is the perfect fit for me and way more convenient than keeping a physical food journal on me at all times. The pictures are so much better than measuring and counting every little thing in the foods I make at home. I’ve already lost half an inch around my waist in around 9 days because of this apps support of my mindful eating. So thrilled I happened upon this app and i recommend it to anyone struggling to make the right food choices. Staying on path feels so good and so easy with Ate!

title: Awesome and SIMPLE
body: This is a great food journal app - whether you want details or just a quick picture to remind you of what you’ve ate it’s perfect. I personally need a simple tracker of what I’m eating. I don’t need to document every single calorie or carb, but I do want to keep track of what I’m eating. The pictures make it simple too. Plus you can go back and choose why you ate it, where, was it good, are you full, etc. You also get to set goals and why you’re doing this... it’s just an awesome food journal ... so much easier then others... like MyFitnessPal — way to much freaking work! With this you have the option to add in that stuff or not and just track your food!!

title: Great for Whole 30 and food tracking if CICO isn't your focus!
body: To be perfectly honest, I usually use MyFitnessPal to track my food because for the past almost-year I've been tracking my calorie intake and it has helped me lose weight.

title: It’s about the food, not the calories
body: Initially looked at this app for my child with an ED.  I needed something for them to track their food without getting messages about losing weight.

title: amazing!
body: My boyfriend has been trying to get my to keep track of my diet for years, and he uses my fitness pal. I personally dislike my fitness, I’m fairly healthy and I just got sad over the calorie counting. BUT THIS APP IS AMAZING. It really just makes you think more so about WHAT you’re eating and making you really thing about what you SHOULD eat over typical alternatives. It’s super user friendly, and it’s much more of a simplistic healthy mentality of just choosing healthier meals. AND I LOVE THE GOALS YOU CAN CHOOSE FROM AND TBE OPTIONS TO MAKE YOUR OWN.  Plus I convinced my friends do it with my, which makes it more fun to share the healthy meals we’ve been eating! (the only downside is water tracking is part of the premium version)

title: Building a healthy relationship with food!
body: I’ve struggled with an unhealthy view of food for as long as I can remember. I’ve tried multiple “fad” diets... and all failed, of course. None of them focused on fixing the real issues. Calorie counting, macro tracking, etc just exacerbates obsessive thoughts for me to the point I just give up and feel miserable. But this app! I’m so happy to have found it. I needed a photo food journal, for accountability, but this app has so much more. The questions help you dig into the important stuff...why am I eating? This has helped me watch my level of emotional eating and pay attention to my hunger signals, which is critical for intuitive eating. Thanks to the Ate team. Keep up the great work!

title: Fun
body: I picked up this app on a lark more to keep a diary of the amazing food my partner has been cooking up during quarantine than to diet. I set my goal to “yum yum yum yum.” But since I’ve started using it, I realize that it does help me keep track of my portion sizes and how often I’m eating things I need to reduce, like sweets. The interface is easy to use, and I’ve yet to run into a problem. Moreover, there are no ads and the entire thing is very tastefully done — some apps feel like cynical cash grabs which are intentionally unpleasant to use. This app is the very opposite of that. It’s, dare I say it, relaxing? Can you really call a food diary app relaxing? Somehow it really is! It’s just a really positive experience: give it a try.

title: On Path!
body: Are you “On Path”? It’s a simple question, but it answers everything in a nutshell. I’m not great about taking the photos but I always log with the text feature. This app came to me at the perfect time. I’m listening to “Phit N Phat podcast and they highly recommend journaling. This app is a perfect way for me to track my eating and my eating habits. I’m having a health issue unrelated to weight and/or weight loss. I’m trying to track down what the trigger is and if it is in fact food related. Journal is definitely helping me align my symptoms with what I have been consuming. And I am getting better about taking pictures. It’s so quick, then I can put my phone away and enjoy my meal.

title: Great option to keep you honest with yourself!
body: My wife and I started using the app at the suggestion of our nutritionist. We struggle with portion control and food choices and she suggested “Ate” as a way to log our portion sizes as well as what we’re eating. Neither of us like to write down every little thing in a food log, but taking a photo of our plate whenever we eat makes it easy! We think it’s a success so far for us because it’s a gentle reminder at meal times when we take that photos to moderate and make better choices. Plus the ability to share our timelines with each other as well as our nutritionist makes it easy to get support and encouragement.

title: Great app so far
body: I am currently trying to break out of excessive calorie counting, and this app allows me to continue the habit of tracking my meals without obsessing over numbers. I love the encouragement to be mindful about your emotions and why you are eating as well. The only thing keeping this app from being 5 stars for me is the inability to turn off intermittent fasting information. Intermittent fasting may work for some people, but can rapidly devolve into triggering harmful behaviors for people who are prone to/recovering from disordered eating (Ex. could trigger trying to extend fasts for longer periods of time). Given that otherwise this app seems like a great alternative to traditional meal tracking apps for folks with EDs, I wish that information could be optional.

title: So simple it works
body: Simple and perfect! I’ve tried similar apps and what makes this one stand out is that it doesn’t take up exorbitant storage space. This will make you reflect on why you ate and how you feel about it, removing any judgement and not imposing any limits. This works for me: If I’m setting the rules then I’m responsible for following the rules. It’s helped me overcome overeating. It has made me aware of timing of meals for intermittent fasting. The company seems respectful of users, in thoughtful app design and limited emails that you can opt out of. If it’s not a functionality, it’d be nice to see stats like how many meals I was bored, percentage of meals in the car. Otherwise, great app, recommended 110%.

title: Solid Food Journal App
body: After a lot of looking around, I fell in love with YouAte a little over a year ago as a great visual food journal — much easier than keeping a physical journal or writing every meal in a text log.

title: Perfect!
body: LOVE this app. (I heard about it via a healthy living podcast..so grateful!) I can easily track my food choices, either by picture or text, without doing any measuring. It also lets me make quick notations about my meals. Because of this, I find I’m willing to be accountable with my food choices without judging myself. It tracks fasting times, allowing me to delete an app I previously used. I upgraded to the premium , much cheaper than other food premium apps, which allows me to track liquids and activities. It syncs seamlessly with my Apple health info.  So very easy to use. The support staff responds very quickly with any questions. Well done!

title: Love this app!!
body: Mindfulness is the key to any attempt and/or success in changing behavior, and YouAte is the perfect app for focusing your attention. I have had an unhealthy relationship with food for a long time. In fact, it borders on addiction and obsessiveness. With YouAte, I love just snapping a picture of what I’m eating and in the moment assessing how I feel about the meal. No more counting points or writing every single thing down. Also, because I am a competitive person, I don’t want to go “off path”, so this helps keep me on the straight & narrow. I’m still using the free app because this is working for me.  If you are a “visual” person, I guarantee you will love this app!

title: So helpful!
body: I highly recommend this app for anyone who wants to be more aware of what they’re eating throughout the day and the times they eat. It’s a great first step towards a lifestyle change and helps keep you accountable for what you’re eating, how much, and how it makes you feel. I feel inclined to make better decisions already! I am 19 and with school, work, and social activities it can be easy to fall off track or keep snacking, but with this app it has helped me to be more disciplined and focus on portion control. I wouldn’t want a bunch of pictures of unhealthy, prepackaged foods on my path. I love this app a lot and I’m excited to see the results it helps me to achieve.

title: done with counting
body: i am on a mission to mindful eating. i don’t want to diet, change my body, etc. i do want to feel physically better and to be intentional about what i eat. Ate was a godsend in a world full of calorie counting (or “macro” counting, same difference). i love that i can be accountable to myself without measuring myself. and i’ve only been using it about a week but it’s already helping me begin to pause before mindlessly grazing off my toddler’s plate or out of a bag of chips. so i can enjoy my snacks and meals by taking a second to put them on a plate or at least to snap a photo before putting them in my mouth. i hope apps like ate are future of nutritious, body positive eating :)

title: Fantastic app for Intuitive Eating!
body: I’ve been on the diet roller coaster forever and recently wanted to try intuitive eating. I found this app by searching the App Store for Intuitive Eating and I have been blown away by how much this app has helped me stay on track! You simply take photos of everything you eat and at the end of the day you can see a collage of everything you ate that day. You can also easily note your hunger level, where you ate, mood/satisfaction after eating along with your photo. It’s so easy to log meals and so effective for keeping me honest and on track. I’ve been logging for a week now and have already lost 3 lbs! Great app!

title: Mindful & No Counting Calories!
body: Because of this app, I’m more reflective when I eat now. I’m more purposeful and aware of eating. Counting calories on other apps has messed with my guilt & nutritional density intake. When I’ve eaten mindlessly, this app helps avoid the downward spiral of hopelessness and continuation of bad habits. I can hop back “on path” because I have a birds-eye view of the past few days of success.

title: Finally! A food tracking app to LOVE
body: I have never been able to make myself keep a food diary or track my food for more than a few hours - Ha! - because I HATE writing it down, looking up portion, blah, blah.

title: Everything about this app is perfect
body: Traditional calorie-counting apps have caused my eating habits to become disordered in the past, but I also struggle with accountability if I don’t keep track at all. Ate is simple enough that I don’t get lost in grams and macros, but open-ended enough that I can really set and track any goal for myself. The UI is gorgeous and intuitive. It has a crazy amount of different options and not a lot of flipping through menus trying to find those options. I’m honestly considering buying a premium subscription because I love the amount of thought put into this app even though I don’t need any of the premium features

title: The Best Food Diary!
body: My husband and I started a new eating and exercise program which includes recording your daily food intake. On the first day we we're manually recording our meals when I discovered this app. With the snap of your camera you can photograph what you ate and even make notes. It times the gaps between meals too. If you forgot to snap a photo you can add a text entry with the note and time. The only thing I haven't figured out is how to add a photo after the fact with the right time (I accidentally took a pic outside the app and couldn't log it in ). That is a small thing in exchange for the convenience of the food diary.

title: The BEST food journal app!
body: I LOVE this app! I am working with a nutritionist who wanted me to take photos of what I was eating. I find that I am way more honest with (and actually remember) what I eat with this app. I especially love how you can document the when, where, and why with the photo. And, a REALLY helpful feature is that it documents frequency/time between eating...with summaries at the end of each day. I would love it if this tied to my other calorie tracking food journal (myfitnesspal), but I totally don’t mind documenting in two worlds either...one is visual/emotional documentation, the other is more data driven. GREAT idea...I rave about this app a ton!

title: Grateful for this
body: I’ve only been using this for a week, so I’m in that “first blush of love” stage, but so far, this has been just what I was hoping for-convenient, yet effective.

title: Lovely food tracker app
body: I went from obsessing over my calories to this app. This app enables me to not feel guilty over calories but it makes me eat more mindful. I seriously can self reflect and see what time of the day I cheat my diet and why. I love this app and am so grateful I found it!

title: Nice job simple & effective
body: Good app! 🙂 It’s a great tool for those who want to be more mindful about their eating patterns without having to log calories etc. Super quick & easy! Also I find it helpful when I can’t think of what to cook or my husband wants a meal I made previously - I just scroll up on my logs to help me remember the meal/ingredients. One thing that I think could be improved is when you go to your day recap if you posted more than one photo within the time frame it only shows one of those photos in the recap rather then the full recap of every photo taken. Could you guys adjust this please?! Thanks ☺️

title: Really balanced approach
body: It’s simple, like Instagram, which makes it easy to adopt and get your bearings.

title: Good app, but could (easily) be great
body: I like the simplicity of the app and the non-shaming aspect of being honest about recording less than healthy eating habits. What would make it great, would be the ability to download the pictures of foods with the associated time/place/feelings, so you can more easily revisit and see the details about the less than healthy eating episodes. This would make it much, much easier to come up with appropriate coping skills to handle those episodes. The graphs are great, but I’d like to download a linear timetable of food and emotions to look for patterns. I’d also like categories of breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks to better understand true hunger eating vs. emotional eating. Thanks!

title: Non judgmental, complete, easy
body: This is definitely the best food tracker out there. I love the ability to add your own questions. However a few things I would change: add an electrolyte option for liquids, it is very difficult to add multiple pictures to the same meal: I changed my settings so that pictures taken in the same hour count in the same meal, but it’s still not working. There should be a way to upload multiple pictures to the same meal at once. This short falling of the app makes me feel guilty for having “seconds” which is very negative (it’s ok to have seconds!!). Also there is no way to track macros which is annoying.

title: Great meal tracking app
body: A couple of weeks ago I was searching for a meal tracking app because I didn’t want to count calories but I still wanted to keep track of what I was eating. I tried SHYE but I didn’t like the lack of flexibility with meals and that you have to pay to save your meals after a certain date. Ate is much more flexible and gives a great visual representation of your food. I also like that I can write notes about my food and choose the circumstances and emotions I felt at the time of eating. This allows me to look back on my day and see what can be improved (or just drool over all the good food I ate!)

title: Non-judgmental breeds honesty
body: I love how this app is non-judgmental and so customizable.

title: Like the app but wish there were a few other features
body: I really like this app overall. I wanted to keep track of what I was eating without counting calories or trying to look up really specific food items. I love the on/off path function. It’s motivating to me to try to be “on path” 100% of the day. I really wish though that you could either: indicate a meal is a snack and/or indicate that you are slightly off path vs. way off path. Let’s say I eat a small portion of something that I feel to be off path. It affects my percentage of on/off path the same as an entire off path meal would. I would like to be able to indicate that I ate something small that was off path but see that it was only a minority of my day.

title: Perfect app for weight maintenance
body: I lost weight counting calories. It was a necessary evil to get to the weight I wanted to be, but it also takes the joy out of eating (living?).

title: Good app, small tweaks could improve it
body: I like this app a lot! I understand why they have to charge for the versions that allow you to track activity, but I wish that feature were included in the free version... for now I just take a photo of my workout and add it to my day. I think the app would also benefit from allowing more write-in stuff in each little category. For instance, writing more specifically how something makes me feel after eating as opposed to picking one pre-picked word or little emoji.. sometimes I have a mix of feelings or whatever. I’m hoping that sticking with this for a while allows me to identify more in terms of my eating and binge patterns, triggers, etc.

title: Helping with emotional eating
body: So, I’m struggling with emotional eating. Just stopping and reflecting on my feelings about my meals through the “feelings” pop up, which asks questions like where you were, who with, restaurant and hunger level. Just seeing what I’m eating and understanding the feelings that food gives (or not) is helping my underlying issues with why I’m eating outside of hunger. It’s also helping me healthily transition away from calorie counting and just looking at how much food I’m consuming and how often. It’s been a week and I love it. I feel so much more in tune with my emotions and less prone to eat because of stress.

title: Great app for tracking
body: The app works best with people in your group to share and discuss options. The interface with your friends could be improved, where a comment could be shared or recipe by text or by url, on the same page as the picture.  However, I love the fact that it is not about calories.  If calories in vs calories out was truly that simple, than it would be that simple to change a lifestyle just as simple.  People are catching on that other factors play a bigger role and research is supporting these finds.  Ate is ahead of most trackers at this time, at the forefront of modern dietary thinking.  Great work!

title: Ate is a keeper!
body: I think I’m probably in the same boat as everyone else as far as trying tons and tons of other food diaries and not enjoying them. Counting calories is such a tedious and daunting task. I hate feeling bad about what I eat. This app is designed to remind us that we are human and food is meant to be enjoyed and remembered. My favorite feature of the app is the notes/Q&A within your food logs. The Q&A doesn’t ask for calories, nutritional facts or anything of the sort. It just simply wants to know what did you eat and how did it make you feel. Definitely recommending this app to friends and colleagues! Thank you, Ate!

title: Enjoying ATE
body: I am really enjoying the ATE app. I am utilizing it to track my food consumption so my dietian can help me with maintaining my current weight. With the friends option she is able to see what I am eating, and can now help me see why I might be loosing weight and what we can add to maintain a healthy weight.

title: Easy Breezy!
body: I’ve struggled with my weight most of my life. I tried all kinds of diets and programs throughout the years. What I LOVE about this app is that I can food journal without the soul-crushing experience of having to add quantities and calories and search for foods online and measure and weigh everything!! That always sucked all the joy out of eating for me! Having a visual record of what I ate is a game-changer (and I’m middle-aged so I’ve played ALL the games before 😁). It has made me more mindful and it has simplified everything. I’m down about 5 pounds in just a few days. I just really love the way this works for me! 😃😍😁

title: Ate!
body: This is a great app. It is easy to use offline which is a plus for me. I like how it gives different experiments to work on and challenge you. These experiments are explained and help you think in a unique way. After you eat you are given questions about why, where, whom, and the such you ate. This is a great way to track your mode, your reasons for eating and helps you become aware of your habits. I’m very pleased with Ate. The best part is that you don’t have to have the premium access to exceed. Thank you for all your hard work by making this app so user friendly.

title: Great for mindful eating
body: Like others, I have done several programs in an attempt to eat healthfully and control my weight.

title: Awesome app!
body: I am so happy this app exists! I’ve been trying to eat healthier, and wanted a way to track my food without stressing myself out over calories and macronutrients and all the other data food-tracking apps collate. YouAte is perfect: when I snap a pic, it makes me remember what I’m actually eating, the short reflection questions help me consider why I am choosing a particular food (and if there was a better choice I could have made), and the “path” set-up is guilt-free and allows me to evaluate what’s on track for me. It’s the best way to mindfully track food without tracking calories.

title: Finally an app that gets it!
body: I stumbled upon the Ate app while looking for something simple to help me keep track of what I eat. I do like “the other” popular app but find that tracking calories hasn’t helped me. The Ate app is great for figuring out the WHY behind eating. Eating is good! Eat to live and live to eat - but do so in a way to be healthy and happy. We are all taking pictures of our food anyway, why not do it to better ourselves? It’s simple, and I think about whether I’d rather report back with picture of a donut that I ate, or a spinach omelette that fed my soul and nourished me. Well done!

title: Great for changing behavior
body: A month with this app and I improved my eating behavior and dropped some pounds. Like many food apps it serves to “correct” you just through the act of tracking (“Do I really want to log that?”) Unlike other food tracking apps I didn’t feel a sense of “failure” if I blew past some calorie (or carb, or whatever) goal. It was also nice and easy to do a picture, and I found on days I did really well I felt a sense of satisfaction looking back on the day in review and seeing all that healthy food. This helped to reinforce positive behavior as opposed to eliminate “bad.” Good app!

title: Useful!
body: I’ve been using the app for about a month now, and it’s been helpful as I navigate my health goals. It’s helped me identify patterns in in the kinds of foods I’m eating and how much time I’m waiting in between, which is key as I work on balancing my blood sugar. I appreciate that I can share my food diary with an accountability partner. I would however suggest modifying the on track and off track feature to allow a little life nuance. Ex: If I have great nutrients on my plate, but a larger portion of carbs than what I’m aiming for, and waited way too long in between meals, I would be unsure which option to chose, and am unsure if I can opt out if that feature.

title: Chill, but super effective food tracking app
body: I was looking for a food journal app, but tired of tracking calories or quantities. Really happy to find YouAte! As someone who thrives on accountability, I can see what my friends are eating and they can see mine (actual pictures of meals). I also love that the meal photos don’t automatically save to your phone. It’s the perfect way to visually see what you eat, but not have to spend valuable minutes of the day tracking (which was never sustainable for me). Seeing photos of what you are is a really powerful tool. Definitely motivates me.

title: Wonderful program that works!
body: I was impressed with how much info Heather's assist. gathered so 2 perfect coaches could be chosen specifically for me. Met an hour with my mindset coach - she's great - told her my issue and after discussing she said text her anytime I needed support before our next meeting. Love that. My food coach had unique suggestions right off the bat that made a difference! I've dropped 5 lbs in the first week and was not hungry!

title: Camera Visually based is the best feature
body: I have read some of the critical reviews about trying to bypass the camera feature. I wonder how it would be easier If you have tried to sit down and type in after every meal , snack , water , coffees and so on Vs snapping quick shot, then to quick questionnaire about how you felt, where you ate, how you ate and so forth . Previously I tried and couldn’t. Now I am doing it with great ease and accuracy

title: Dev Request - Great app but can we fix the camera permissions limits?
body: Love the concept of this and the latest additions! I also love that it works with my Apple Watch. I would use it all the time, but I hate leaving on camera privileges for apps (I trust you guys but just think it’s a good privacy habit in general). If the app let you use it even when the camera permissions were off (say you wanted to do a text entry or just upload photos from your gallery or turn camera permission on sometimes), it would be perfect. Thanks in advance for the consideration!

title: So usable
body: I love so much about this app. I love that there are so many options provided for what “on track” might look like for any individual; It’s not just a weight loss app, and it’s not tied to a particular fad diet; it is meant to help a person reach their food goals, whatever they are. I also like the little arrow that nudges me back in track. I’ve used a lot of food tracking apps, and this feels the healthiest and the most sustainable. I’d love to see a report included that lets you look at a glance at how on track you’ve been over over several days or weeks.

title: Mindful Eating
body: I really like this app!! I’m not a fan of calorie counters, but I’m realizing I need to be more intentional about what I’m eating. The goal of “happy and healthy” is perfect, and deciding whether something is “on path” or “off path” towards that goal is completely up to the user. It makes me be reflective, without feeling ashamed or stressed about the exact calorie count. I’m also a big fan of all the statistics it gives me— I feel like I already have a better understanding of my eating habits and have made some important changes that I hope to maintain with this app.

title: Easy and helpful
body: I have used calorie counting apps/sites off and on for years. They are absolutely soul-crushing for me. Too time-consuming to use, and they inevitably lead me towards obsessive and disordered eating. I love that this app helps me keep track of what I’m eating and make healthier choices without reducing it to meticulous number tracking. I’m not hugely consistent with using it yet, but I’m improving. I feel better when I use this regularly. Thanks for providing a simple way to help me feel better and choose wisely, without making it all about numbers.

title: Simple!
body: My doc asked me to provide her with a food diary. I just don’t keep track well so I searched for a simple app to track what I was eating. Nothing was simple!  They all wanted vast info such as macros and carbs and calories. Then I found YouAte. I just snap a picture of my food (or enter a description if I forgot before I started shoveling)!  I just share my day with my doctor and it sends an index picture of my meals to her. The app keeps me on track because I know I don’t want to take a picture of food I should not be eating or food I’m eating due to stress or boredom.

title: Easy Tracking
body: I love, love, love this tracking app. I am not focused on calories so much as I am on listening to my hunger cues and making healthier choices. This app is perfect. I can snap a picture and be done if I’m in a hurry then add notes later when I have time and feel the need. It lets me instantly know how well I’m doing at staying on track. If I forgot to take a pic, I can just put in the text of what I ate. This couldn’t be any easier. The one thing I would change is under How did you fee, I would add a full button. There’s a difference between satisfied, full, and stuffed. Or maybe make it customizable.

title: Fantastic and so easy!
body: This is a fantastic app, quick and easy to track what I’m eating and drinking throughout my day without adding each ingredient or scanning everything. I love the ease of quick taking a picture and being able to go back and take note of my food choices.

title: Love love love
body: I love taking photos of my food anyways (especially for my insta) so this was the perfect app for me to track my daily intake. I love that it’s simple, straightforward and there’s not pressure to count calories - am I on path or my goals or not? If I ever forget to upload my photos, I can always go back later. Super simple yet effective. How did I only just find this app????? I also love all the bright fun colors and progress charts and that you can share with friends. After I finish my review, I’m going to upload a photo of my breakfast to my app - smoothie bowl anyone?

title: It’s working for me
body: I’m not really in to calorie counting or dieting in general, but I am trying to get rid of my baby weight so I gave this a chance. I’ve only been using for a week and I am down 2 lbs., which doesn’t seem like much but hey it’s a start in the right direction. This app makes me more mindful of my eating choices and I really think it’s helping me stay on track. I like that it’s so simple and easy to use. I like that my friend and I can motivate each other and chat through the app. My only negative feedback is that I wish there was a section to log fitness just so you can also stay accountable with that.

title: So happy!
body: “Ate” was an accidental discovery & what an amazing find... What a wonderful way to food-journal, make notes about my feelings & eating habits, and stay self-motivates, without the self-judgement I often feel from forget food-journaling apps! :) I feel like “Ate” address my total well-being, not just calorie-counting, macros, & exercise, but also my emotions, eating habits, and goals on a much deeper level. And I love that it’s photo-based; Makes tracking everything so much easier cause it’s all visual! A great app for those who want better balance in life & health, not just weight loss. :)

title: Learned to work around it
body: When I first started this app I was taking photos and adding them before I ate as the plate look full and one can see what I was eating but I found this is not really accurate. When I look at the time my last ate, it would be off about 30 ish minutes depending on how long I knew it took me to eat. I like being as accurate as I can be on these apps so I can use it to my advantage. So, the solution: I take the photo before I eat and once I take my last bite I will import it with the current time. The new problem? Sometimes I will forget to import the photo later...

title: Fantastic App !
body: I absolutely love this app because I like to put my food into my Cronometer app but I don’t want to do it immediately because I’m busy with other things so I can take a video diary of what I eat and then at the end of my day put it all into my other Cronometer app and really helped track my nutrition for health and wellness it’s so easy it’s so quick and it really gives you an accurate picture of how much you’re eating in the quality your food is right in front of your eyes and don’t forget mindlessly what you’re eating each day

title: My favorite food diary app!
body: If you’re like me, typing every morsel in a food tracking app gets old very quickly. Journaling your food in this app is quick and easy – just take a pic and tap the on- or off-path button. You can also add more details if you choose, such as why you ate and how it made you feel afterwards, which really supports accountability. You can easily see the history of your food choices, which is very helpful. Aesthetically pleasing and straightforward UI/UX. Thank you for developing and continually updating this free, simple, and fun app!

title: Efficient. Simple & Easy!
body: Honestly this app is GREAT.

title: MAKES YOU WANT TO IMPROVE!!
body: This easy to use app is addictive!!! Just by taking a picture or entering what “you ate” and being honest as to whether it was on “your path” it shows your progress.  It asks simple questions like were you hungry, where were you when you ate, how you felt after.  It really makes you think.

title: Simple and efficient.
body: I love this app! It’s a perfect food diary that helps keep me accountable. I don’t have to write anything down, just snap a pic when I’m eating and choose the path. You can even click on the picture and answer a few questions about your meal. Seeing it all laid out before you really helps to put things into perspective and makes me conscious of what I’ve already eaten. If you need all the bells and whistles, you’re in the wrong place. If you want a simple, user-friendly and fun food diary, you should get it!

title: A picture is worth 1000 words
body: I have food journaled in the past and always slack off when it comes to counting calories. It takes a good amount of effort and once you miss a few meals it’s hard to get back on track. Snapping a photo is easy. I’m able to review all of my choices quickly and know whether I’m on track or off track. I love that you can take a photo and it doesn’t store on your device. It only stores on the app. I always seem to be low on memory so that is a great feature.

title: Everything’s included
body: Most apps that look helpful have a “bait and switch” technique where they show all of the features in the App Store, but then once you download the app you learn that you can only put in two meals a day, or set up only one notification, or the camera feature is a paid option. Not with this app! It’s easy to use, everything’s included, it doesn’t decide for you what is healthy or unhealthy, and the accountability of tracking what I eat has done wonders for my diet choices. I love this app!

title: Love it!!
body: This is kinda exactly what I needed! When tracking includes calories, it really hurts the way I eat. This is great for just remembering to think about it a little without making me feel pressured or guilty or anything.

title: Great app!!
body: Quick and easy way to make a food journal-snap a photo and go! This app has been great letting me see when I stay on track with my healthy eating and when I don’t. The percentage reminder of how often I stay on track motivates me to make better food choices. I can set a goal to work towards and it helps me feel successful. I also really like that it has an added layer to let me connect why, where, and how I’m feeling when I eat. It’s also customizable so if I’m feeling something not listed, I can add it to my choices.

title: Accountability without calorie counting
body: The way this app is structured has made it super easy for me to keep myself accountable to my goals while enjoying food and avoiding calorie counting which I know is detrimental to my mental health. Doesn’t shame you when you go off path, and let’s you choose what’s on or off your path for the day which lets me decide ice cream is fine and on path when I’ve been eating salad all week. Love that this app encourages sustainable changes to your diet rather than crash dieting and restrictive eating/exercise regimens.

title: This is what I’ve been looking for
body: I wanted to start keeping track of my food choices, but calorie counting felt so overwhelming that I would give up two days in. This app has been amazingly powerful even though all I’m essentially doing is recording what I eat, why I eat it, and how it makes me feel. It’s quick and easy, so I don’t mind sticking to it. I’ve already lost weight after using it for a week and a half because it’s made me think twice about some of my bad eating habits. I really love this app! It’s so helpful!

title: Great app and simple!
body: I just wanted a simple way to track what I was eating, because that’s the best way for me to be honest with myself! All the other apps I looked into were very complicated and seem to be designed for people who want to make a profession out of tracking their food, and I just wanted a simple log. This app does have a lot of great options, but one of them is the option to just very simply track what you eat and whether it was on trrack for you or off track. Simple and very helpful!

title: I absolutely love it!! :)
body: Ate is a straight to the point app. That focuses on keeping you on track/path and since a picture is worth a thousand words it works.

title: It's a Snap with this App
body: I've been using this app for 3 months and I love it! It's literally a snap of what you're eating pick the path for the food and you're done!

title: Love it!
body: I have done calorie counting & weight watchers. This by far is so much better. No obsession over every calorie, micro managing or guesstimate when you go out to eat. Even if I over do it on a meal I get right back on it with my next meal. I am also visual person  and seeing what I ate over seeing it as a text is so much more impressionable for me.

title: Ate is great!
body: I’m really enjoying this app. I’ve noticed I hold myself more accountable for what I’m eating, especially when it comes to snacks. And I’m getting a better sense of what foods make me feel full and satisfied for longest. It’s nice to recognize how often I’m treating myself as well as when I’m skimping or being lazy. Plus keeping in touch with my friends is an awesome aspect, as some of us live states away from one another. We already enjoy trading recipes and sharing new places to eat, but Ate takes it to whole other level!

title: Best food logging app for intuitive eating!
body: This app allows you to choose whether you are making the right choices for yourself and your personal goals. All of the questions about the food are editable. I don’t care to count calories or macro nutrients. I do care to track my hunger, and my own feelings before and after I eat. I also care to track the different colors I incorporate into each meal. This app allows for all different choices. It is fully customizable, and even the free version is fully developed. I love this app!!

title: Easy to use! Love it.
body: Finally a simple food diary app. Other apps are too complicated. Photos are such an easy way to track what you eat (love that photos don’t automatically save to my phone’s camera roll) plus you can write notes underneath & also keep track of how you feel afterwards. You can choose which “steps you will take” to reach your specific goal & the app provides you with tips and a little research for each different “step”, which is something I love. Thank you developers!

title: Empowering the Eaters!
body: I am a foodie for sure but as I get older, my body can’t handle the splurges like it used to.  I find through this app, I can feel accountable for what I eat...make my choice in what I am trying to accomplish with diet choices and have a documented review of what works & what does not.  Right now, I am just finding my way back on after time off & it’s so helpful.  I am looking forward to using some of the challenges presented here- like portion control or more mindful eating.  Thanks for the empowerment 💛

title: On Task
body: I learned about the Ate app from my daughter who’s an eating psychology coach. I’ve wanted to rework some of my eating habits and she suggested I give this a try. I’m really loving it and am finding that the act of photographing everything is helping to keep me on task! It’s very easy to use and I love that my daughter and I (she lives across the country from me)can see each other’s meals throughout the day. And love that we can write little comments to each other. I’m very happy to be using Ate to help me stay on track!

title: WOW!
body: As someone who deals with disordered eating, this is EXACTLY what I needed.

title: Exactly what I needed
body: I am not at all good about being aware of what or how much I eat. This is a very simple, easy to use app that helps me to keep track of what I eat and also helps me remember to eat snacks to keep my metabolism going. I like that it doesn’t ask me to count calories or even have me eat anything specific at all- it’s all up to me to eat what works for me at the time. It also encourages me to eat in a way that I can take a little pride in. I’m sure I’m going to lose weight with it.

title: LOVE design and concept
body: I am a huge fan of this app’s design and overall approach to managing a healthy diet. Has helped me to observe and reflect on my food choices without judgement. Not only can I identify snacking or craving periods, it has helped me manage emotional eating through awareness. I can go back and look at my forever history and pinpoint trends to address. One note - very frustrated with app crashes but not sure if due to phone or app itself. Overall recommend to download this and check it out!

title: Great app - definitely a breath of fresh air
body: I give it 4 stars because I would like to be able to track calories with it a little more efficiently than having to pair with a picture, but that may also be antithetical to the point of the app. So much better and more positive than MFP or other “diet” apps, and would work for so many situations. I would also like to see maybe all the pics of meals side by side for the week to just see overall progress. The pay upgrade was also worth it if you are serious about your health.

title: Changed my life for the better
body: I have never written a review for an app before but I needed to for this one. After only a week of using I have not binged and am on the right track to losing weight. It is extremely easy to use (unlike apps where you have to track every little thing) encouraged me to make healthy decisions and doesn’t make me feel guilty if I eat something bad. 10/10 would recommended I could write a book about how much I love this app

title: Better than expected!
body: Heard about this app from Phit and Phat podcast. I was more than surprised by what it offers without the add ons $$. It’s super user friendly, makes you think about your food choices via the questions they ask and only takes the amount of time it takes to take a pic to track. I love it so much that I DID pay for full use and it got even better! I’ve added and removed questions and answers to meet what’s important to me. I just can’t say enough good things 😘

title: Great Resource for Mindful eating
body: This app was recommended to me by my nutritionist as I just had Bariatric surgery. I was struggling with mindfulness while eating and this really helps me control how much I’m eating and how often.

title: Great app!!!!
body: I have struggled with binge-eating for many years and have tried MANY different diet plans, eating apps, etc. But this very simple app has been the only one that has actually worked. You take pictures of every meal/food you eat and answer a few questions after you eat. After a day, you can spot your eating habits. After 1 week, I have already lost 5 pounds....no dieting... just being aware of my eating. I feel so much more happy about my eating and body-image!

title: Great app!
body: Been using it for nearly two weeks now and it’s a great option to keep yourself accountable for what you’re eating without obsessing over it.

title: I think this is a winner!
body: I decided to try this app because it’s as simple as taking a picture...  I like that we have a visual reference for what we ate for the day.  I’ve done MyFitnessPal and WeightWatchers and the tediousness Of counting calories had prevented me from being consistent with my food journal.  I am hoping that this will be the winner. I also appreciate the questions that are offered to make me more mindful of when I’m eating is helpful since stress makes me munch more than I should.

title: Easy and it works
body: I was looking for something simple to use to track my food each day.  I don’t do points or calories or exchanges but am working on intuitive eating.  This is so easy as I just snap a photo before I eat.  If I forget I can manually add it.  And the questions are really helpful at identifying the reasons I eat.  Now I have a good record to discuss with my dietician using facts - not what I thought or remembered.  This is a great tool for anyone trying to make positive changes in their diet.

title: Simple yet effective
body: The minimalistic interface of this app makes it an easy and enjoyable way to track what and when I eat. I feel that this format is more useful than other food diaries I’ve used as it encourages you to really consider the motivations behind the food that you’re eating and to develop a healthy state of mind rather than an attachment to the calories in each meal. I also appreciate that the app’s key features are available to non-premium users!

title: Easiest food tracking app!
body: Forget counting and measuring! You already know what you’re supposed to eat and not supposed to eat. This is the app for you. I love that I can take a picture or write out what I’ve eaten. And, the app takes an extra step to help you understand WHY you ate... stress, cravings, boredom, hunger; while also allowing you to set your goal to be visible every time you open the app. I’m pleased after 1 week of use. I am aiming for intuitive eating not starving on diet after diet.

title: Mindful eating
body: Really this app is about mindful eating... and that’s why I love it. Oh and because it’s a snap to use! I got it because I’d like to lose a few pounds, but more importantly, I wanted to have some accountability/food diary-type method for studying my eating trends. This app is perfect for that. No, it’s not a true weight loss, calorie-counting app. But there are tons of those, and only this one (that I know of) that is really asking the core questions of WHY you’re eating, how, how did it make you feel.

title: Awesome customer service and great app
body: This app is just what I was looking for to start more mindful eating.  Super customizable and easy to use. The best part of this app, so far, is the customer service. I had some trouble with the subscription service because of the family Apple account and emailed with a question. Tom was incredibly helpful and patient—we emailed all weekend long, and he didn’t refer me to anyone else. Thanks to Tom, I’m enjoying my subscription service :).

title: I love this app!!
body: I really despise counting calories. This app is a great way to help me keep myself visually accountable based on portion control as well through writing notes about how the meal made me feel. Both mentally and physically (and if it gave my any digestive problems). I only wish they would include a special area for water consumption. It would also be extra great if there was a way to log workouts to keep track of days you end up eating more due to intense calorie burn.

title: Easy peasy food journaling
body: I’ve tried using other apps to keep track of what I eat, but this is the best by far. No need to figure out the portion size, weight, volume - just take a photo and you’re done, enjoy your food. 20 mins later, the app checks in and asks you to reflect on the meal you just had (prompting you to consider if it was ‘worth it’). And if you forget to take a photo, you can also just write a text description- perfect!

title: Tracking
body: Love the app to easily track my food patterns. I like that you are responsible for marking if you are on track or off path. It helps you be held accountable for your actions and decisions. It is very simple to use. You can add comments so if you eat something off path you could add a note what was happening how were you feeling when you are it. This helps you figure out some triggers for yourself. Would recommend the app to others.

title: WONDERFUL!
body: I began using the ‘ate’ app as a way to journal my journey through the elimination diet. It has helped in creating a sense of mindful eating and accountability. I have shared my experience with this app with friends and convinced them to join. We are able to motivate one another through our shared visual journaling of food and open a dialogue of what our relationship with food means and is.

title: Great way to visualize your diet
body: I love this app!
