I’ve tried using calorie counters before (like Lifesum) and often forgot to record my meals, and even when I remembered to, it was a hassle to find the exact thing I ate and record the exact amount I ate too. With the “ate” app, you’re able to just snap a photo and record how you feel after a meal (satisfied? Still hungry? Happy?). I love that this app focuses on how you feel. There are also no advertisements... what a plus:)

title: Helpful to see what I’m eating
body: I have always used LoseIt to track my calories but it wasn’t until I started using ate that I could really see where my calorie intake was coming from. I like looking back over a week to see if I’m loading up on carbs or if I’m doing a better job and eating more fruits and vegetables. I will still keep tracking my calories in the other app but I’m going to use this for keeping a photo journal of my eating. Thank you, ate team!

title: Great tool!
body: I’ve been using this app for over a week. Amazing how it keeps you on point.  Since I’m documenting everything I eat, you have a clear picture of what you are putting in your body every day.  It definitely opens your eyes & motivates you to “stay on path.

title: perfect for what I need!!!
body: i love the app bc it’s so quick and easy to log your meals, plus it always shows you statistics about the way you’ve been eating... rn i’m 95% on path and I soon hope to be at a hundred. it aldo goves you your meal freauency so you can actually consider how often/how much you eat. the app also gives you a chance to really think about why you ate and how it made you feel which is really nice... 11/10 would recommend!!!

title: Love Love Love
body: I wanted something easy and straight forward to keep track of my eating habits for my own benefit as well as my doctors. This app (the free version) allows me to do just that, snap a photo, and keep is simple - is it “on path” or “off path” - you can make it more complicated and add other health and exercise components into it with the paid version but for me the beauty of YouAte is in the simplicity and detail of its user interface, very well done! Highly recommend!

title: Perfect for my purposes
body: Great app, easy to navigate and use. I needed to track my diet for health reasons and this helps me do that wonderfully. I like that I can just snap a pic of my food and not spend 15 minutes trying to find every item I put into my meals. I don’t care about calories or macros, so this app is perfect for my purposes. I love the positive reinforcements I get for consistently inputting my meals and the data visualizations. It’s helped me tremendously! Thanks for the great app!

title: Incredibly intuitive way to eat mindfully.
body: Looking at what you’re eating and whether it’s on the right track or not gives me a moment to ask myself WHY.

title: This is the app I didn’t know I needed
body: I thought I needed a fasting tracker app so I downloaded a few to test which would be most intuitive and this app was one of them. Quickly realized it wasn’t so much the fasting tracker but the mindfulness and the photojournaling of my food intake that really clicked for me. It offers ease of use and a judgement-free zone which is exactly what I needed to create a healthier relationship to my eating habits. This app is a game changer for me!

title: Great app!
body: I had been tracking my food with My Fitness Pal for several years. About 6 months ago I started doing intermittent fasting. I decided I still wanted to track what I ate but wanted to take the emphasis off of calorie counting. I searched the app store and found Ate! This app is perfect! It lets me keep a record of what I eat with an easy photo and gives me the option of creating a healthy behavior to focus on. I highly recommend this app! Thanks to the creators!

title: Great app for mindful eating!
body: I have tried many different solutions for being healthy.  I know what to do but I don’t always stay mindful of portion sizes and types of food.  I love that there is no calorie counting, just being more aware of what I’m eating and drinking.  This is exactly what I need to help me take better care of myself.  I liked it so much, I have 5 friends also doing it with me which keeps me even more accountable. Thanks for a great app!

title: Awareness
body: I am a new user who really enjoys the ease of keeping up with what I eat the “ate” way. Sticking to the journaling for the short time I’ve been using the app has made me more aware of every bite I take, and perhaps more importantly, WHY I eat. I especially appreciate the ability to post later as my schedule is hectic and time for personal time is often at a premium. I look forward to building a healthier diet soon with the help of “ate”.

title: Excellent app
body: I love that this app keeps me mindful of my food choices without counting calories or macro nutrients. I can identify my meals as “on path” or “off path,” which helps me avoid associating food I enjoy as good or bad. Overall this app has changed my relationship with food and allowed me to develop a healthy yet accountable way to track my meals. 100% recommend those who need  accountability to make healthy and mindful food choices and avoid going OCD on logging calories.

title: Easily track any food goal
body: Ate can track any food or hydration goal with ease. Trying to eat more veg, or whole foods? Trying to eat less sugar? Trying to lose weight? I love that Ate is so flexible, yet so fast and easy to use. And best of all, it’s 100% positive reinforcement. Really makes me want to keep improving, rather than thinking about my failures. That helps keep me on the path (and avoid going off the rails).  And very reasonably priced for the value to boot.

title: Great app!
body: I love this app. I’ve tried food logging before but it is such. a. chore. I always end up deleting the app because it’s too much trouble to log what I’m eating. This app has a simple process - snap a picture /make a note that its on or off path. You can add a few more details but that’s all required. You can see what your meal is and how long it’s been since you last ate. All around a great app and I’ve been telling all my friends about it.

title: Great tool.
body: I was looking for a food tracking app that didn’t require weight stats, I was not having much luck and then I found Youate! This app is a great tool and provides a user friendly format for keeping track of daily food intake, water, activity and most importantly pre and post hunger/mood. Approaching nutrition with a on path/off path perspective has helped me to really see what it means to eat healthy, dark chocolate shared the fiancé, on path baby! BigThanks to the youate team! Love, Slay all day.

title: Accountability
body: I’m currently in a weight loss group competition, it’s more for accountability and support of each other in the journey. Every evening I send the daily recap of what I ate to my group. This has made a HUGE difference is my ability to stick with my healthy habits. Something about sharing pictures of what you ate to your friends really keeps you honest to yourself about making the best decisions. I recommend this app to everyone.

title: Love this App
body: I just started using this App and I’m really loving it.  The photos of the meals makes it so much easier to work with a nutritionist who can just take a quick look to check in on my weekly eating patterns.  I’ve used many Apps where I needed to record every morsel and I’m thoroughly enjoying the ease of this.  I love the notes at the bottom and use them every time I record a meal or snack for my own personal reflection!   Great idea!!!!

title: The only food tracking app I will ever use again
body: You don’t need data about every teaspoon of ingredient in what you eat. More than that, you don’t need the mindset or life experience of collecting that data.

title: Love This App, but it Has a Major Glitch
body: This app is amazing! For several months it worked great, but then it started showing the wrong date every time I used it. Drives me nuts! I finally deleted it and installed a different app for food tracking. I missed this app, so I installed it again. Today is Tuesday, November 5, but the app says it’s Monday, September 30! What gives?? Is there a way to correct this problem? I really want to use and enjoy this awesome app!

title: Great app
body: I never write reviews for apps but I’m seriously loving this one. It’s only been a few days but it’s super easy to use and it’s really helping me. I struggle with restrictive eating and binging. It’s helping me become more aware of my cycles and habits and also seeing that even if I mess up once or twice in a day I’m still doing well. I have less guilt around food. For this reason I love the photo timeline, it’s much more satisfying than a written journal.

title: No calories!!
body: I love that this app is a way to track what i’m eating and how it makes me feel! i already have a general idea about my calories intake and when food groups i should be focusing on so i don’t need calorie counters like myfitnesspal. i love that you can set goals and make your own path instead of restricting certain foods to feel like you’re making progress. Definitely a great way to get into intuitive eating!

title: Nice and easy, and increases awareness
body: Ate is keeping me honest. Before I decide to eat something, I consider whether or not I want to ruin my percentage for the day by eating something that’s not on my path. I love that the app keeps track of my daily percentage. I had never thought about that before. It’s nice that you have the option to write in a meal in case you forgot to snap a photo, which I often do when I’m excited about eating! 😄

title: Great app.  Easy and quick to use!
body: I really love this app.  I have 2 small children so trying to log food meticulously is nearly impossible to keep up with.  This app makes it quick and easy.  I love that you can see a snapshot of everything you ate for the day and share it with someone for accountability.  The questions you answer about each meal can help you gain insights about your eating habits pretty quickly.

title: Results!!!
body: Wow! Using this for 10 days i have been reaffirmed on my healthier habits. In 2 weeks i have lost 5 pounds and found that i even have the motivation and energy to exercise finally! Just half an hour a day combined with ketogenic choices have made the weight come off easily. I eat when I'm hungry, I'm full faster and satisfied. I don't need afternoon naps and i am setting a healthier example for our teenage girls. I will keep this up fir sure!!

title: Food freedom.
body: I never thought I'd actually find food freedom. Tracking without guilt, no calories, no good or bad, listening to hunger and honoring your cravings. I immediately stopped dieting. I've been dieting my entire adult life and I can officially throw out the books and drop the obsession. Love that I can snap a photo and go on with my life and not think about food anymore. Who wants to go through life counting calories or carbs? Not me. I'm living my life, finally!!

title: Intuitive and useful
body: I’ve tried lots of food trackers but have fallen off since they are so time consuming to use with the specific foods for calorie counting. This simplified approach to snap a photo and decide if it’s on or off path is a great visual into what I’m eating, how frequently I’m eating, and whether I’m at my 80/20 goal without a lot of tracking effort. I’m looking forward to seeing what features they add to incentivize the premium upgrade.

title: Health Coach Sarah
body: Love the concept of this app! Super convenient and easy to use. If you forget to add something you can add it later at your convenience. I only wish they gave a free trial for a few weeks. Some things are locked unless you purchase the app. I’m not willing to spend money unless I can see how it all works. Also, I wanted to tell my friends and get other people to check it out but you have to buy it before you can share with you friends too.

title: Just what I was looking for, but didn’t know it!
body: I can’t stick with calorie and micronutrient tracking - they are too much work, they bum me out and I’m not sure they even help. I absolutely love this app. I love the on-path/off-path concept and having the photos is fun and lets me know well enough if I’m eating right. Plus I can look back for ideas of on-path things I liked when I can’t think of what to eat. Love this!

title: Eating disorder recovery
body: For years, I have struggled with eating disorders. Because of that, I am super dubious of any form of food tracking but this app changed my life. It keeps me conscious of not just what I’m eating but when, where and why which are JUST AS important factors as what you’re eating, something other apps don’t take into account. I can’t believe how amazing this app is. I’ve never written a review before, but absolutely had to. I love this app!

title: Good app
body: I have use this app for 2 weeks now. While making you more aware of what you are eating it is also helping me keep track of my habits. Example if I’m eating too much or not enough of certain foods. If you forget to take a picture when you eat you can still describe what you ate and what time which is really helpful. I am  anxious to find out how to eat better and lose some weight.

title: Easy to use! Upgrade isn’t much $$!
body: Tracking calories is burdensome and restrictive. Our food choices should come internally, not from external restrictions. But we’re busy—getting in touch with hunger cues and understanding why we eat is so crucial, but hard without accountability (another key feature of Ate!). It’s so easy to use! I upgraded to premium to track my workouts, moods, and liquids. It’s not much/month. Totally worth it!!!

title: Easy
body: I like this app because it’s a simple visual way for me to track/remember what I ate throughout the week. I had a severe eating disorder and apps that track calories are a no go for me as they are a trigger still. This is a gentler approach to food monitoring through photo taking. I also like that you can share your data with friends. My husband and I are able to keep each other on track this way.

title: Very Helpful for Mindful Eating
body: Since I stated using this app a few months ago, I have lost over 30 lbs. While I am much more interested in how my blood work looks soon, this app has really helped me change the way I eat in a way that’s sustainable for me.

title: Great way to track food without obsessive over calories!
body: I really like this app. It is an easy way to track what you eat without having to input/ research specific calories, grams of fat, carbs, etc. I also love the “on path, off path” feature. I can see when I do unnecessary snacking in the day and try to correct those habits. Also, if you forget to take a picture of your food, you can add text.

title: Only one beef...
body: I love pretty much everything about this app, except... the “share your day” image.

title: The Best
body: Food journals notwithstanding this App is the best one that I have ever found. I have tried several ways to track my weight but this one gives you the advantage of keeping track visually everything that you were eating. At a glance, you can see what you’ve consumed and how much, no more guessing. It’s easy to forget what you’ve eaten, with this program that has been a eliminated.

title: Love it!!!
body: I am loving this new way of logging food & nutrition. It allows me to see what I have been eating throughout the day and keep track of my habits. I also appreciate that it asks about why you are eating & how you feel after. It is a great reminder as to why I’m eating. I would highly recommend if you are looking for a new way to log food. It goes great with a mindful or intuitive eating philosophy.

title: Love love love this app!!!
body: Finally an app that helps me keep in track! I have done weight watchers for years, Paleo, tried Keto etc... this app is exactly what I needed to help me. I wanted to eat a granola bar right after dinner... really really? But I didn’t want to have to take a photo of it so I drank water instead! Thank you! Thank you! I have been doing this for about a week and have lost 3 pounds. It is making me drink more water too.

title: Well thought out and visually focused app
body: I have searched for and tried out a lot of different diet tracking and food journal apps, and this one is by far the best. It is fast and easy to snap a picture of your meals and the UI is simple, but perfect for keeping you on track with your diet & weight loss goals. I also love the social aspect where you can invite your friends and share your food journey.

title: Now this makes sense
body: I started using the Ate app a week ago and couldn’t be happier. I finally have found a tool that makes a lot of sense to me and it’s something I actually enjoy doing. The visual reminder of what I’m eating is ke for me.

title: Great App
body: I really like that this app focuses on your food goals and doesn’t obsess on the numbers. Taking a picture of your food forces you to slow down and not grab food without noticing. To kick the app up a notch, I would allow for a personal reminder immediately after the picture is taken such as “take three deep breaths before eating” or “be grateful for this meal” or “I hope you are sitting down “.

title: Wow. Just...wow!
body: I can’t rave enough about this app. The hardest thing about managing my eating is embarking on change. This is so gentle, easy, and fun!

title: Great App, Easy to use
body: I love this app it’s so simple to keep a food journal. At the end of the day it gives you an overview of the meals you had. I love that it even reminds me to eat! When you always on the go it helps to be reminded. I like when you forget to take a picture you can just text in what you had. It gives you some accountability. Glad I downloaded it! Great Job app people!!!

title: Easier than Writing
body: This is a great way to keep a food diary without having to write everything down. I love taking a picture it's quick it's easy and it's very accurate. I can even look back and see what I was eating on weeks when I gain weight or lost and it definitely makes more mindful of what I'm eating when I have to take a picture. I would definitely recommend.

title: Great app!
body: This app is great for tracking eating habits without the complexity of calorie counting. I love the feature to choose for myself if it's on or off path and the "percentage" on path. It's very helpful for finding balance in eating instead of thinking of your day as all bad or all good. The app is super easy to use and user friendly, and the team behind the app is very quick to respond to suggestions or issues.

title: Love it!
body: I’ve only had the app for a couple of days but I already love it. I’ve learned so much in just a short amount of time- like the fact that I am grazing all day long and am often eating just because I’m bored and it’s there. This is definitely making me more aware of what I eat and will hopefully help me make more informed choices. App is very user friendly and I have had no issues.

title: Very user friendly
body: I really enjoy this app very easy to use and plan to use it help me be the new me.

title: Just what i needed
body: I was looking for a simple to use food journal. This is perfect. It not only lets me snap a photo but i can give additional input as to why, where and how i felt. It helps me be more mindful of what i eat. It also has a reminder option i have to try. Also hoping my friends will join me using this app. Its another great way to encourage each other to eating healthy.

title: Great tracking app
body: I love this app. I started using it about a month ago and it has been so helpful in giving me insights into my eating habits. I’ve noticed that I eat a lot while distracted, I eat too close between meals, and I snack a lot. What’s great is that this information is consolidated into a chart for me. There’s an option to track additional info in the paid version, which I’m considering 🤔

title: No More Calorie Anxiety
body: I’ve been looking for something like this for a while. I needed and easy way to keep accountable with my food choices but not be constantly trying to figure out what else I could eat in the day to fit within my calorie budget. Easy to use. Recommend to anyone who knows what to eat - just needs some help keeping accountable to yourself.

title: Keeps me aware & accountable
body: I maintained a 100 lb loss for 2 yrs but then slowly drifted away from my new healthier habits & regained 20 lbs. This app has brought me back to being more aware of what & when I’m eating and also why; that along with the added accountability has helped me turn things around and I’m headed back to my goal weight. This app is terrific, I’m glad I tried it and have continued to use it.

title: A gentle but effective nudge towards better habits
body: This is a great app, with a lot of good features. I’m not generally into this kind of thing, but taking pictures of everything I’ve eaten for a week has given me some interesting insights. And strangely just my unwillingness to take a picture of potato chips is enough to steer me towards going out to the garden to pick a handful of strawberries instead. Highly recommended!

title: A happy app user
body: This was exactly what I was looking for! I wanted something that helped me understand my relationship with food and eating, especially emotional eating, while trying to avoid obsessing about food. Anytime I tried calorie counting, it didn’t help me understand why I was eating BUT calorie counting often made me feel guilty or ashamed, which was counter-productive to getting me closer to health.

title: Love this app
body: I really love this app. I used MyFitnessPal for years with success, but I needed a method that was less anxiety inducing. The app simply asks whether what you’re eating is on your chosen “path.” The simplicity of it makes it easy to stick to but is such a great commitment device for eating healthy.

title: Simple and easy, very visual and new
body: I like this app because it’s easy and simple. Also has a function to make a note, like why you eat, where you eat and how you feel about it.

title: So much easier and more effective for me than calorie counting!
body: I am a busy mom and have had no success with calorie counting because it’s time consuming and I can’t sustain it for long, but simply snapping a picture is very quick. It’s easy to track everything and makes me pause before I just eat whatever I want whenever I want, so I am actually not grazing anymore.

title: Love it!
body: I’ve tried other food tracker apps and this has, by far, been my favorite. I love the ability to take pictures of my food and then put notes on top of the pictures. It’s helpful when looking at my daily recap!

title: Ate
body: So far I am liking this app my friend is following me and I like sending messages to each other.  it helps to see a picture of what I do every day and also helps deter me from eating things I don’t feel good about because I have to post a pic of it, also  nice writing about how I felt about the meal. Sometimes I forget what made me feel tired or crappy now I have a nice diary of that.

title: Such a great find!
body: I did MyFitnessPal for a time but it became an obsession which only made my binge eating disorder worse. With this app I’m finding it’s a great balance for me. I appreciate the questions that follow your meal making you more in tune with the experience. I also like the goals feature to keep in mind for each meal. It’s a gentle tool that is helping me become more healthy and balanced.

title: Wonderful app!
body: I love the focus on food journaling to give you insight on daily habits. The app has helped me shift my lifestyle and attitude around food by being more aware of what, but more importantly, why I eat certain things. I would highly recommend it (and have to many of my friends!) to anyone looking for a lifestyle change rather than endless cycles of calorie restriction and guilt.

title: Love it so far
body: This app has really helped me tackle my emotional eating. I’m training my brain to think about what I’m eating, and as the habit forms, my brain now thinks about what I’m eating BEFORE I eat, leading to better choices. It does not reinforce a “reward” system with food/calories like EVERY other weight loss plan seems to do. It’s been less than two weeks and I’ve lost four pounds almost effortlessly.

title: Easy to Use
body: I like this app because it is easy to use and does not take a lot of time to fit it into my schedule.  It is simple and keeps me on track for healthy eating!  I tried the Premium version but did not care for it.  I really wanted to like it but I felt it complicated things for an old lady like me.  For some younger, tech savvy  folks it would probably be great!

title: Love it. Keeps me aware
body: I love journaling and have been doing it for many years.  This app is allowing me to journal my meals in a visual way. I love the fact that I can recap on a given day and see how well or bad I did and try to do better the next day. I also do intermittent fasting and love that it shows how many hours I have not eaten. Thank you to the team for developing this app. Just what I needed.

title: LOVE this app!
body: This is exactly the type of food app I have been looking for and didn't even know it. The problem with other apps is that they are so focused on calories and "diet" mindset. This is perfect because I can just take a picture of my food and really look back and see if I am hitting my goals or not. I can't wait to see what this app brings in the future!

title: So easy to use!
body: I recently downloaded this app and it's so simple yet effective when trying to see what you eat in a day. I just wish the app has the option for when you click on your photos you can see the whole thing and not just in a small square. Overall I think this is a fantastic app, will be using it for a while!

title: Be honest with yourself about food!
body: I really like this app for the simplicity of tracking with photos or text, and time between meals. The on or off path helps me keep on track or encourages me to get back if I had a slight derailment. The only change I would really like them to make would be to include exercise. This is an important component for me. Currently, I don’t like if I put a text explanation of working out that it resets the countdown clock for eating.

title: So easy!
body: I love this app! I enjoy keeping track of what I eat, but always get bogged down in details, so just being able to snap a photo is ideal for me. This is the longest I’ve ever stuck with some sort of food tracking! Knowing that I’m going to take a photo also helps me plan my meals better to make my plate more varied and colorful - I am starting to become proud of everything I eat.

title: Perfect for recalibrating
body: This is just what I needed for an honest look at what was going in my mouth on a daily basis. I love I don’t have to track calories but can mark things as “on” or “off” track. I was surprised to learn how much less healthfully I was eating than I assumed! Those small off track treats were really adding up. I have recommended this to friends and family!

title: Fun and functional
body: I had been using another app to track my meals but was feeling overwhelmed and anxious about counting calories and worrying about macros that I didn’t know how to even interpret or adjust w/o a nutritionalist!

title: Fun alternative to calorie counting
body: My husband and I are having fun logging our days and seeing what each other has been up to while we aren’t together. I’ve used my fitness pal in the past but it gets a bit much. This is an easy, and I think more effective way to eat more mindfully and see an overview of how good or bad you’ve been to your body! I love it.

title: New attitude
body: I used a calorie counter last year to drop 30 pounds. Yeah! But now that I want to maintain instead of lose, I needed a new motivator. This is perfect for that. It makes me conscious of what I’m eating without having to figure out how many calories are in home prepared foods. The questions and insights from the app are great learning tools and reminders to think about why I’m eating.

title: Love it!
body: This app is genius. No one likes counting calories and always ends up being unsuccessful when keeping track of what one eats. This makes it SO much easier. A picture takes a second, not 15 minutes and still worrying if you included everything accurate. It’ll definitely help me with my food patterns.

title: Love this app!
body: So much better than counting calories, writing in a food journal, etc. Just take a photo before you eat. Record notes if you want and at the end of the day get a recap! A few days worth of recaps and I see where my pitfalls are and where there’s room for improvement. But no shame or guilt! I recommended this app to all my friends. I love it! ❤️

title: Love the app just 1 wish
body: Love this app. So much more sustainable to take a photo than to try to track all my macros. I am trying to only eat when hungry too so I love tracking the time between feedings.

title: This works for me
body: My husband and I started tracking our food with Ate and found it to be very user friendly.  I am an amateur photographer and have enjoyed taking pictures of my meals. It is also great to be thinking of why I’m eating. The app is great at prompting. I would appreciate being able to keep track of water consumption too.

title: Provides great insight to habits
body: I’ve tried calorie counting apps and regular journaling but to have a visual is so helpful. It is easy to use- allowing you to see your portions and timing between meals, letting you determine what is “on track” or “off track”. Simple and versatile. I also love the short questions that provide great insights to your habits. Overall my favorite app!

title: Phenomenal
body: I use this app daily to record my food intake. Intuitive design. Beautiful layout. Helpful tutorials. I see no evidence of this platform becoming bogged down with ads in the future. I recommend this app to family members and friends struggling with mindfulness. If given the opportunity I would be an ambassador for this app in a heartbeat. Thank you Piqniq for this wonderful dietary tool! 🥰

title: ATE is working for me
body: It is easy to log everything I eat. If I miss one I can add it in text. I start every day adding my weight and comments via text. This has kept me focused on my goal which is to have everything I eat nourish my liver or my gut. I’m 88 percent compliant. I love knowing that number. I’ve lost five pounds in 10 days. Easier than I thought possibly.

title: Amazing!
body: I love this app! I’ve been wanting to track my meals without counting calories, and Ate allows me to do that. With Ate, I’m able to visually see how much I’ve eaten, log the reasons why I ate, and describe how I felt after eating. This has really helped me to cut down on mindless snacking. I would 100% recommend this to anyone who wants to track meals without the stress and pressure of counting calories.

title: Mindful eating that’s finally easy
body: I’m using the free version and am honestly pleasantly surprised by this app and what’s available in the free version. I appreciate that the camera portion is available as soon as I open the app (fewer clicks!) and that I can set reminders to actually follow up on how I feel about a meal afterwards. The recaps have also been great to send to my nutritionist.

title: Great for tracking diabetes
body: I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes and have been using this app to compare my glucose numbers with what I ate.  I also set and alarm for myself for 1 hr after my meal to remind me to test.  This app helps me remember how long until the last time I ate and is very helpful for showing my doctor the sorts of foods I’ve been eating. Its a must for newly diagnosed diabetes patients....

title: Easy way to track food
body: The app is easy to use and convenient.  I like being able to snap a picture of my meal before eating.  Knowing I’m going to have to do that helps me be mindful of the choices I’m making.  But if I make a food choice that isn’t on my path I don’t feel guilty or shamed.  I believe it is teaching how to have a good relationship with food.

title: Super motivating & easy to use
body: I don’t have time for long and involved food journals. This app is wonderful accountability with just several pictures a day. It tracks my time between meals and I can see at a glance a collage of what I have eaten that day. More than once I have made a good meal choice because I wanted to continue my “on path” streak! Thanks to the creators of “Ate.”

title: So close!!
body: I love the idea of the app and it would be an easy 5 stars If it had the ability to put certain pictures and or meals in a "favorites" bank to use again and again. I eat the same thing a lot of the time so this would be such a great feature! Like the same idea that iTrackBites uses you can hold down on a food and it gives you the option to copy it today. lOVe it!!

title: Most unique and functional behavior app !
body: I’ve used other trackers and get caught in the weeds over their format and detail. What’s essential to me is awareness: what I’m eating, when and why. This app allows me to link my thoughts and feelings to my behavior, which is essential for change! Thank you for helping us revolutionize how we look, think and feel about eating!

title: You measure your own food goals
body: No matter what dietary plans you have for yourself ATE can give you a visual track of it. Each meal is also analyzed for your mental/emotional responses. This helps remind you of previous healthy favorites and keeps track of why you reach for food items in the first place. ATE is a very versatile app for food tracking. Try it today.

title: Super Easy
body: Super easy to use if you’re just looking to track what you eat without counting calories. I love that I don’t have to search for the specific brand and then figure out the serving size. It’s great for tracking what you eat to be honest with why you’re eating, when you’re eating and how it makes you feel. I’ve learned a lot so far!

title: I always come back
body: I’ve had this app for a while now. I always come back because it’s the easiest one out there. It’s not plagued with ads, I can log my food. I’m super lazy about logging food. I use Noom, I’m only able to log my food on Noom because of this app. If I don’t have time I take a pic & log when I get home. Love it, & highly recommend it.

title: Simple but helpful
body: This app is definitely a lot more simple than others that have you log every piece of food you eat. Granted, if your goal is calorie counting, you want to do that. However, this app of helpful in creating good habits around food more than managing your micros. Overall I have found it helpful to keep me on track.

title: Can Do This!
body: Keeping a food journal has never worked for me, but I can take a picture of what I am about to eat.  Then I can go back later and fill in the details about what I ate.  Having to take a picture does make me stop and think before I eat.  I am using intermittent fasting so I love that I am given how many hours ago I had my last meal.

title: Helpful & Easy To Use!
body: I’ve used other photo based food tracking apps and prefer this one over others. It can be as simple or detailed as you want it to be, super fast to open and snap a picture when you’re in a hurry, and easy to scroll through and see how your day was.

title: Takes some getting used to, features are all over the place
body: But I am really liking this app so far. I like the recap collage that is shareable with the notes or your tags (too bad not both on one, but at least it gives you options). Looking forward to working with this more. I’m sure I haven’t figured it all out yet. Maybe a tutorial video would be good.

title: Making eating healthy a little easier.
body: This app was recommended to me by my nutritionist and now I use it with one of my best friends as well. I love two things about it. It makes it easier to determine the amount of time between each meal (I’ve been told to eat a bit more regularly) and a fun way to keep friends accountable for what they eat.

title: Something Different
body: I think this app is helpful in a very different way from other apps aimed at healthy eating. It helps reduce obsessive counting and monitoring using a few clicks. A picture is worth a load of measures. It gets you thinking in more simple terms about the food and portions you are choosing to eat.  You can look back over a period of time and get a sense if you are on a good path or deviating too much.

title: Sooo glad I found this app!
body: Best diet journaling app ever. So easy to track what you’ve ate with a simple snap of a pic. And even easier way to look back at your day by simply looking at your pics no reading detailed info. So glad I found this I’ll never nutrition journal any other way. I do Tosca Reno’s eat clean diet so this is perfect since I don’t waste my time counting calories.

title: Perfect app for people who just want to know
body: This application is precisely what I needed to quickly see what I’ve been putting in my body, and enables me to reflect on my choices with candor.

title: Perfect for helping you eat more mindfully
body: I don’t want to calculate calories every time I have a snack, and I don’t want to write a journal entry for every meal. I do want to eat healthier, and keep track of how often I’m reaching for a snack. This helps me do exactly that. Super easy to use and I can feel better habits forming after just one week. Glad I found this app!

title: Delightful
body: This app is amazing. I love the fact that I’m not counting calories (that is a very undesirable habit).  The app has several different challenges that help be more cognizant of how I feel when I’m eating and what I eat. The ability to see what I eat is so relaxing and motivated me to continue eating better.

title: Love it!
body: This app has everything I’ve been looking for and I’ve tried them all. So easy to navigate and doesn’t bog me down with numbers like calories and macros. At the end of the day I can see my pictures of all the food ingested and say yay or yikes!  It even automatically tracks fasts and time between meals. I didn’t even have to set that!  Love it.

title: Wonderful App!
body: I’m a working mom, real life and managing everything plus trying to eat right is challenging. The Ate app makes mindful eating fun and as stress free as you can be. I love it! Just by taking photos and making a short reflection, it is such a refreshing way to feel like I’m moving in the right direction. In fact, based on my scale, I am doing just that! Thanks Ate!!

title: Great app!
body: Very easy to use and a great way to see and analyze what you consume during the day. I became more aware of what and when I eat. I was not trying to lose any weight, but I feel much lighter now. Also love the ability to add people to your group and see what others eat ( picked up a few really awesome snack ideas). Strongly recommend!

title: No stress-beautiful-learning about myself.
body: I have used many other apps to track my food none have taught me as much as this one.  Having to take a picture tracks my time, my feelings, where I am, who I’m with etc.  a few days in and super, super helpful.  I’m on the free version. I’m hoping a paid version will graph it for me.  💕

title: Love this app
body: The Ate app is extremely practical and useful for users like me who are trying to keep track of their eating habits. I like the lil reminders it gives me and I feel better using it daily. I only wish I could use some of the other privileges without having to pay, that’s my only complaint. It would be nicer if I could have access to some of the options...

title: LOVE, Perfect & Simple APP!
body: This is perfect for food journaling... I love that you can add notes to each meal too. I have been working on trying to become healthier a bit at a time and this is really really helping me so far. I was writing everything down but it is so much quicker and convenient to use phone and helps to see pictures of my meals.

title: Simple and helpful
body: I had heard for some time that taking a photo of every meal helps you stay on track.  So far, I have found this to be true. There's something about having to stop and look at what you are about to eat that makes it impossible to eat mindlessly. This app meets my needs. If you are looking for a food photo diary app without a lot of unnecessary bells and whistles, this is it.

title: Game changer for gestational diabetes
body: I have gestational diabetes and I use this app to make notes on what I've eaten and what my blood sugars were. I love that I can see exactly when my last meal was, how long I've gone in in between meals, overnight fasting, and what I ate all without the hassle of logging calories. I can make notes on exactly what I want to remember about a meal. This app is amazing!

title: I was so tired of writing everything out!
body: With YouAte, I’ve switched my method from listing every food to photographing every meal and snack. It has been very freeing! I am now more concerned with how and why I’m eating. And when I do get “off track,” YouAte shows me that I can get right back ON track and not ruin my whole day. Simple, meaningful way to begin mindful eating.

title: The most amazing app if you struggle with emotional eating
body: I can’t say how much I love this app. It keeps me encouraged to stay on my healthy eating journey and to keep going when I’m not perfect. I love that I can track social and emotional eating over time and have better self awareness without guilt. Pair this with Food Freedom Forever and it’s the perfect food addict’s recovery course.

title: so far so good! just one suggestion
body: this app has really been helping be accountable and there's none of that toxic calorie counting I've experienced before.

title: Must get
body: I have tried many other apps like this but all of them shove expensive premium memberships in you face from the beginning, personally I don’t want to spend a lot of money to stay fit so I find it so convenient. On top of that even without premium it still works a charm. Would recommend! ❤️

title: Encourages useful reflection
body: Sometimes I just want to keep track of what I eat without committing to calorie counting. This app lets me keep track so simply and it helps me to see trends based on my own reflections on what I eat. It’s been surprisingly useful. (I downloaded and deleted the app about a year ago. I’m glad I gave it another try.)

title: Tracking without judgment
body: I have been waiting for this app for years. Traditional food tracking apps have always triggered really restrictive and disordered eating for me. This app asks only that you log the meal itself, how it made you feel, and whether what you ate is in alignment with your goals. No calorie counting or guilt trips.

title: Gives me mindful eatting without all the fuss of tracking
body: I tracked for years and my goals have shifted to make life less complicated. I still have the accountability of writing down everything I eat without so much effort being out into the details, which at this point I just don’t need!

title: Very easy to use!
body: I love this app and how easy it is to use! I don't feel like I waste any time in my day logging my meals like I would if I were tracking calories or macros. This is an excellent way to stay on track with healthy eating! It's helpful that it shows the hours between meals and overnight fasts too. Overall a great app, and free too!

title: Loving this
body: I can say that in the few days I’ve used the app, I’ve been choosing to make better food choices.  It’s truly made me stop and think about how I’m feeling when I’m eating off path. Or wanting to eat off path.  I’ve come to see how tied my emotions are to my food choices. I would highly recommend this app 🤗❤️

title: Awesome!
body: So far I am truly loving this app! I just got it today but I love the set up! Easy to navigate and esthetically pleasing. It’s so different from the (many) other apps I’ve used! I especially like that it helps the user to be very intentional about the food choices being made and the reasoning to those choices. So far, I’m a fan!

title: Ate App
body: I absolutely love the app. It is simple, quick and easy to navigate through. The ability to see the pictures of the food I eat and see the time line next to it has opened my eyes. As well as answering the questions- they never get old, they only get more real which helps in changing!

title: Simple, beautiful and effective.
body: I love the simplicity of this app. I mainly use it to track that I am eating only when I’m hungry and for this it’s been perfect. There’s so many other cool things about it I love that it asks how my meal was and I can kind of journal I ate too much for it was just right. Builds a great sense of continuity and in achieving your goals. Great job!

title: Just what I needed to create healthy habits
body: I have been wanting to hold myself more accountable and Ate helps me so much! I love that it is just a photo or text log with no nutritional info.  I also love the questions you can answer. It has helped raise my awareness about my eating habits. I am even thinking of going premium! Thanks for a great app!

title: Easy, flexible, and data driven
body: Better than other apps for recording food because:

title: Great App!
body: I am very pleased with this app. I used to keep a food diary and it is great, however I prefer the visual food journal better. I have a better visualization of my food intake and the app makes me make better choices. I wish that it came with a weight tracking graph as well, it would add more incentive. All in all, it is a wonderful app❤️

title: EASIEST APP OUT THERE
body: I got to a place where I wanted to keep track of what I was eating, but no longer needed to know every single detail about the breakdown. I was so frustrated that every other app seemed to take so long to enter info. I am eating 6 small meals a day, so that just wasn’t going to work long term. I love this app! I think you will too!

title: Easy and private
body: The Ate app is very user-friendly and makes it convenient to track meals.  I like the “how it made you feel” buttons, which allow me to practice mindful eating and be more self aware.  I also appreciate the commitment to privacy, with the option to share info with chosen friends.

title: Exactly what I was searching for!
body: I love how easy this was to set up. Already logged my first meal in minutes after finding App.  I want to remember meals visually and keep short, concise notes on what I like and don't, and if it matches my plan for a whole food diet lifestyle.  I will repost my review after spending some time using the App!

title: Really helps!
body: I tried similar apps but this one gets it right. I was originally sent on a quest for a visual food journal by the 4 hour body diet.  I end up looking forward to my little self-accountability check-ins. And I get a kick out out of quickly staging shots of what I’m about to eat. It’s making my weight loss efforts more fun and successful.

title: Love it
body: Enjoying using this as a visual food journal. I haven’t found another food journal that doesn’t seem cumbersome. I don’t have time to enter in a million ingredients but by just snapping a pic of my meal I can easy see, portion size, if it was a healthy choice etc. I am definitely more aware of the things I am putting into my body.

title: Great!
body: I wanted to keep a food journal without all the calorie counting and weight management, but let me record how I was feeling when I ate something; this app is just that! If you’re looking for something to help with mindful eating, or to keep track of your emotional eating, or just a general food diary, I highly recommend this one!

title: Mental Health meets Food Tracking
body: I have been looking for app that will help me be mindful about food while keeping a healthy relationship with food. This app is what I’ve been looking for. You can totally tell the intentionality that went into creating it and how it promotes a healthy mindfulness with food. Thank you creators!!! Brilliant! Absolutely brilliantly!

title: The Best
body: I have been searching for a truly kind and nonjudgmental app for food tracking for years. So far I haven’t gotten any pop up messages urging me to be successful by purchasing products within the app. That was the worst for me in other apps. I look forward to using this moving forward.

title: Great helpful app!!
body: This app honestly helped me so much in the way I felt about food and my eating disorder. I was able to see what I was eating and write how I felt about eating it. I’ve realized that while I continued to use the app the less I really needed it, however I do still use it just to keep my attitude up about the foods I am eating :):)

title: Love this app!
body: I’ve been counting calories on different apps for years and I hate it! This is much easier to track what I eat every day without counting. I also had some family members join and we’re having fun cheering each other on & keeping each other accountable!

title: Genius!
body: I’ve been looking for an app like this for years! It makes food journaling so easy, but more importantly helps you track why you eat. If you are someone who has been trying to regain a healthy relationship with food, then this app is for you. Thank you for developing the app I always wanted!

title: Great and easy to use
body: It’s so easy to use and helps keep you on track to be healthy in a non obsessive way and natural way. I wish that if you ate something off track that it would look scarier lol like with red or something. I love that it calculates fasting time!

title: Amazing and perfect for me
body: Love the quickness of entry, the notion of simply being on path or off path as a great accountability factor to do better or make better choices before hand since you know you’re going to have to log it.

title: Perfect Match for Me
body: I knew that I wanted something to hold me accountable and encourage me to stick to my diet without having to track calories since that wasn't the point. This app has been perfect!! I have caught myself thinking twice in some cases about what I'm about to eat because I know I have to take a picture of it.

title: Easy to use
body: This app is so easy to use latterly takes seconds to record your food. Just snap a picture and your done. It also is free we all love free and if you want a little extra use out of it there yearly fee is so reasonable. definitely recommend this app and it lets you share your meals if you need

title: Loved it until...
body: Great app for food journaling!  Very helpful for me.  It was working great for 3 weeks and then the data percentages stopped showing up on my profile. I have done everything I can think of and also contacted the developer.  The developer responded quickly and honestly tried to help.  No resolution yet.  It’s a bummer to start over but I will. 🙃 Happy Journaling 😎

title: A great way to stay on track...
body: I have been using the Ate app for a few weeks now. I am enrolled in a Trim Healthy Mama coaching class and this has made my life so much easier! I am able to stay on track with the timing of all my meals.  It’s super easy to use and has truly helped me to successfully stay on plan. Love it!

title: Super sincere team behind this app
body: I LOVE Ate! It makes me feel happy and gives me clarity with my eating. The overall design of Ate is organized and fresh. This system will without out a doubt allow you to enjoy eating all while you discover your relationship with eating. I highly recommend.

title: Very useful app
body: This is so easy to use, it’s fun and so effective. I recently had to change my diet for health reasons to several small meals per day. I am actually enjoying the journey and all the dietary changes I have to make with this app!  It’s completely worth the money, don’t hesitate to get this one.

title: Food journalizing at its finest!
body: This is a wonderful app! It allows you to keep track of what you are eating and you can even invite friends and see what they are eating as well. It is very simple to use and an amazing tool to have if you are trying to keep track of your goals!

title: Easy to use
body: I like being able to just take a picture instead of add every different food in a list which can be tedious sometimes and take up a lot of time as well.  Water tracking is helpful too!  I like the weekly snap shots.   Helps keep me honest with myself.

title: Ridiculously helpful
body: It was always so easy for me to plug in numbers on an app and pretend it “fit my diet” or was healthy. But taking a picture of my meals forced me to realize what I was actually putting into my body, and the app makes me truly recognize if it is healthy or not. Definitely eye-opening and very helpful.

title: Simple & quick
body: Easy to use app if you are a visual person, this app will work for you

title: Love!
body: I haven’t been using this app for too long, but I can say that it does exactly what I need. My biggest problem is boredom eating, and just making the commitment to record all my meals with this app has held me more accountable and made me more aware. This is a great way for people to track their habits without counting calories.

title: Just What I Needed
body: I wasn’t sure what I was looking for when I went looking for a new food journal.  I’m so happy I stumbled onto this one. YouAte is just what I needed. An easy to use (and share) app for logging what I’m eating for the nutritionist that I’m working with. No weighing, measuring or obsessing about calories and nutrients. No wasting my time converting complex reports into a simplified form for her. This app works very well for both of us.

title: Exactly what I needed!
body: What a positive app!!! It is so user friendly and so easy to Personalize. The pictures give me a visual and if I forget a picture or meal - its easy to add it in. I can easily see how my day goes and  why/when I eat. I love that this helps with a lifestyle change and not a diet - and its based on encouragement. 😊 THANK YOU!

title: I love this app!!
body: I love this app!!! Makes it so easy to see if you're on track with your diet! Feature request: would be great to have a monthly calendar where you get a dot if you're on track for 100% of the day!!! That would make this app the perfect accountability companion!!!! 🤩🤩🤩

title: Love it
body: I only wish it would pull out my phone and take the picture since I forget until well into the meal.  After several days I still love this app. The photos help me to remember just what I ate for figuring Macro later. They are also time-stamped which is great for my glucose monitoring.

title: Simple & Effective
body: I love it! This is an effective, easy-to-use app for anyone who wants to keep track of food without calorie counting.

title: Best out there
body: This is the best app out there for picture logging. I do think there is room for improvement. I wish the camera box was a separate option to bring up. That way you might be able to see more of your day immediately when you open and not have to scroll up.

title: Easy to use
body: Easy to use, after a few days easier to remember to take pictures. Love that I can also enter text should I forget a meal. Love the questions, quick, easy and to the point. Would love to track caps. But can always write on notes if wanted

title: Easy
body: This app is super easy to use.  Plus it is all about where and why I eat; do I cook,eat prepackaged; and what I eat.  No stressful calculating calories.  Plus I can link my journal directly to my Ayurveda counselor.  And...I can take a photo or type in the menu so no taking pictures of my food when I am in public!

title: Great app!
body: I wanted to track what I’m eating, but I cook it all from scratch. That means that counting calories takes a really long time - calculating all that is not worth the effort. I wanted a simple log that would still help keep me on track. YouAte is exactly that! Intuitive to use, and the reminders are a nice feature. Thanks!

title: Amazing!
body: I love YouAte! It has made my life so much easier and I feel better about the food I am eating. I’ve lost 8 lbs since I’ve started using youate it’s helping me focus on the quality of food I am eating. I just wish there was an area to log my water. I’m horrible about getting my water in so having a spot that addresses that would help tremendously! Otherwise amazing app!

title: It Really Helps!!
body: I have tried other food tracking apps, and this is the least judgmental and most helpful app I’ve used! I am 5 days in and am already way more mindful about what I am eating, am becoming more aware of my hunger cues and eating healthier! I would highly recommend this app!!

title: Great idea!
body: This is the closest I’ve found to a mindful eating or intuitive eating tracker. Simple to capture what I ate and simple insight-provoking questions after. A few more tweaks, such as being able to add a question or two of my own and adding the location tracker, and this app is perfect!

title: Best food tracking up
body: I love this app so much. It allows me to track my food quickly, with no judgement and truly reflect to make a difference in my eating. I also love that I can follow friends - it’s so helpful to see what we’re all doing. The best part is the ease of use and the simplicity of logging.

title: This app is the best!
body: I love the concept and ease of this app. I have used other apps that were calorie trackers. This one is far superior due to its simplicity and urge towards intuitive eating. I love how it’s basic: on path/off path, and it goes from there. Thanks for helping me stay on track with my weight loss goals.

title: Accountability is key!
body: I need to lose weight.  I’ve tried “everything.”  I know keeping track of what I eat is key, but I am so, so tired of counting (Points, calories, carbs, macros, etc.).  This app allows me to be accountable to myself just by snapping a picture.  It helps, it really does.  I lost two pounds my first week and am pretty confident this is something I can stick with!

title: Very Easy to Use!
body: I don’t write reviews on apps but I love this one. So easy to take a picture. It is helping me develop a healthy relationship with food. Rather than tediously tracking calories all you need is a quick picture and a friend to keep you accountable. 5 stars!

title: So much easier!
body: I am really enjoying this app. I know that keepingA food journal is absolutely essential for me in order to reach my food goals. However, its been so hard to keep up the habit with the other apps I’ve tried like my fitness pal and weight watchers. Ate makes is so much easier!

title: Awesome Awesome App
body: I don’t rate apps. However, this one deserves an excellent rating. Just taking a picture, not counting calories or measuring has made me so much more aware of what and why I’m eating. Even the “on track” challenges are an extra incentive. So easy and the little bells and whistles are a nice addition. Thank you!!!

title: This is the one
body: This is the app you haven’t tried yet. This app has shame-free accountability, great data and is so quick to use, you can track on the go. The other apps you tried quickly stopped being effective because it’s not this one.

title: Love this app!
body: This app is so great! It has helped me keep track of and stick to my eating plan. I love that it keeps track of how long it has been since you ate last. I also love the fact that I can keep track of what percentage I have been staying on path. I would highly recommend this!!

title: Excellent App!
body: It’s been an amazing app to help with food tracking and helping you stay aware how often you’re eating. And it helps you stop and ask yourself if you really want the food if you have to chart it lol. It’s so easy to use even if you aren’t super tech savvy. I’ve loved using it so far.

title: So Simple!
body: A quick and easy way to keep track of meals, mood and circumstances when eating, and water drink intake, plus customizable questions and answers to add to your daily journal. You can keep it super simple, or more complex. I did add the features to track more which works best for me.

title: Best app for being mindful without restricting.
body: I LOVE this app. As someone who was a calorie counting addiction, I can’t stress it enough how awesome this app is. You get visual cues of your intake and can answer questions about your meals. It’s helped me eat intuitively rather than count every single thing. A great tool for anyone struggling with binge eating too.

title: So far so good
body: The good thing this app provides, is the possibility to track your food without any judgement and calories involve... when you are an emotional eater, you need more of a visual clue of what affects you or how or when you made some choices, to better understand how you can address that.

title: Brilliant idea for an app
body: In a visual and digital world, where people take pictures of their food all the time to showcase a meal, restaurant or their cooking skills, this app is a brilliant way to utilize the technology of today to track one’s eating habits, feelings and patterns. I just got it yesterday, but so far, I’m very impressed.

title: Nice app!
body: I was looking for an app where I could easily record my meals AND share them within the app with a friend. I am able to do this with Ate! I was kind of hoping I could make a small group (4 people) so that we could all hold each other accountable, but it works well as is.

title: Easy Food Diary!
body: The ate app is exactly what I was looking for! I wasn’t looking to track calories or exercise, simply what I had eaten in a day. And it’s even easier than I had imagined with the take a picture feature. So if what you’re looking for is an easy to use food diary, this one is for you!

title: Good way to really watch what I eat.
body: Having the visual of everything I ate for the day is very helpful. And the time between meals is much more valuable that I thought it would be. I do miss the THM label that used to be available when describing the meals. But it can always be written in the description.

title: So easy to use!
body: Exactly what I've been looking for. So easy to track food while busy and on the go. Only recommendations are to create a weigh-in track alongside food track and integrate it with friends so they can comment. Can't wait to see how this product continues to develop.

title: No calorie counting!
body: This app lets me easily snap a photo, pick if this fits my health goals or not, and helps me see where I need to make changes to get the most nutrition and live a healthier lifestyle. No obsessive calorie counting, stressing about if I can eat this or that while trying to stay under a certain number. I love it!

title: Life changer
body: This app had helped me to be mindful of what I’m eating. Creating a portfolio each day of what I eat and then sharing it with my friend I’m doing this with has been a game changer.  I’m more aware of what I choose to put into my mouth since I’m accountable to my friend which helps me stick to my goals. Great app!

title: Exactly what I was looking for
body: I wanted a simple way to be more mindful of my choices. I love having a snapshot of what I’ve eaten for the day and how long I’ve gone between meals. I would like if there were more options with different types of journeys with food you could go on or maybe something like that. Otherwise - I really love the app!

title: Super helpful
body: I have IBD and I use this app to help me keep track of what foods caused inflammation in me and which foods worked well. The notes system is super helpful for keeping track of all my reviews. I would definitely recommend this app to anyone with dietary issues.

title: Finally found the perfect food diary app!!!
body: Finally found the most useful app for mindful eating practices! I don’t count calories etc. Other apps were distracting, not great for measuring,keeping track of eating behaviors. I’m do excited about this app. Loving it so far. Very simple to use, customize.

title: Love ate!
body: I love this app! It’s great for my goals with healthy eating. If you are trying to be more conscious about what you are eating without counting calories, this app is amazing. I can also see a graph of why I eat and what I’m eating. It’s really helped me eat healthier and feel better about what I put into my body!

title: I love the ate app!
body: It has literally changed my life!, I accidentally stumbled upon the app after being frustrated with my eating habits and not controlling myself!. It’s became my best friend because it holds me accountable!!, I highly recommend this app to everyone who’s trying to get healthy and live a better life.

title: awesome food tracker!
body: I love how this app lets me visually see what I have eaten today and shows me how much of it was towards my goal. The "on path" and "off path" ideas for my food that I can control is really great and using this app has helped me eat more healthy foods since I want to be more on path. Thanks so much Ate!

title: Frustrating
body: I used to love this app but now it’s not even recognizing my new password. I’ve changed my password several times in a row and every time I tried to enter the new password to reset my path, it keeps saying invalid password. I guess it’s time to find a new app.

title: Simplicity at last!
body: I am a big picture thinker. Counting calories drives me crazy. I know what to do. YouAte helps me see quickly where I’m going right or wrong, Gives me insight into the frequency of being on path or not which helps with goal setting. It lets me create personalized goals to track. Thanks YouAte!

title: Great app!
body: I love that this keeps my accountable with what I am eating but does not focus on calories and make me feel like restricting. I do wish there was an option to just add a written description of what you ate instead of using a photo. I’m so forgetful with it that I don’t remember until after I ate the food and can’t take a photo of it anymore.

title: Easy Food Tracking for Accountability
body: This app makes it super easy to track what I’ve eaten and makes me think twice before mindless snacking.  If I don’t want to take a picture of it or I know it’s not worth going “off my path” for, then I don’t do it.  Simple, easy, and affective.

title: So easy & user friendly
body: I haven’t explored too much yet. But the app is really easy to use. No adds! No one pushing you to use more. There’s an easy eating system & graphs that shows you where your eating is going. And it’s all about you & your goals. Can’t wait to explore more. Pretty sure by the time I learn it all it’ll be a 5 star rating!!!

title: Great way to stay the path!
body: This app doesn’t judge you. It simply asks you if you are following the path you have created for yourself. It works with any diet or lifestyle. You can even have it remind you to eat at certain intervals! Can I give it more than five stars?

title: Visual board
body: Love the option to capture pics of what I am eating. Love the on path or off path notation (cause we know when we are off path and now can see what we ate) with the after meal feedback! I recommend it to others—I like the time stamp and the daily recap option.

title: Great app for keeping track of meals
body: I decided to try this app because I saw someone else post a pic of a days worth of their food on Instagram using it and I’m so glad I did! It is super easy to use and customize and recommend anyone download it and give it a try!!

title: Simple and efficient
body: This app is helping so many people to be more mindful, me included in that. The more we are mindful in one area in our lives the more we will be in others.

title: Wished there was something better, then found it with this app
body: I was looking for a photo-based food log app that wouldn’t shame me for my food choices or give me advice I didn’t want. I’m so glad I found ate!

title: Great App
body: I’ve tried a few diet/nutrition apps but this is the best so far.  Taking a picture at the time of eating is such an easy way to keep track.  I also like the feature of having one or more “coaches” be able to log in and see what your “food diary”.

title: Easy and efficient
body: I have been asked by my doctor and health coach to try and keep track of my meals; this app has a very simple way to keep track of each meal, what time it took place, and whether it met my goals or not. I can enter more information if I choose, but it’s not necessary for record keeping. Sounds perfect!

title: Perfect for me
body: I love love love this app. I struggle with my eating/lack of eating patterns that this app is perfect for me to track behaviors and make sure I’m living a healthy life. It’s not diet or body image focused, and it prompts me to quickly self-reflect on why I’m eating.  This has been very helpful for me to understand myself better. Thank you!

title: So easy to use!
body: Love  this app! So easy to use and getting me on the road to more mindful eating. Didn’t lose weight this week? Oh, maybe because I had pizza several times. When I get more consistent in remembering to take the pictures I intend to upgrade to premium!

title: Works great with Naturally Slim Program
body: I’m using this app while following Naturally Slim principles and it works great. I like the ability to take notes and have a history of what I’ve eaten and when. The friend sharing option also helps keep me accountable. Overall great app!

title: Vital for my eating disorder recovery
body: This app allows me to track food in a productive way for recovery. I no longer worry about calories and now track how I feel, why I ate, and other stuff. Really great app! I can also share my week with my dietician to make sure I’m on track.

title: Great app
body: I have really enjoyed this app. My only problem is I often forget to take the photos of my meal. But by being able to see each day has given me a sense of victory over eating to much. This app has helped me to know I can loss to my desired weight.

title: Nice app
body: So far I’ve only used it to track what I eat (for a week) but it has helped me be more aware of what I eat and why. I have found myself going for some food and then thinking, do I want to add this to my journaling?(which also mean I’ll be adding it to my body), and then I make a better choice because of that.

title: Easy to use
body: I love this app because I can quickly see what foods worked for me and then repeat meal plans to keep getting good results. Plus it’s an easy way to keep me honest with myself and not “forget” how much saturated fat may actually be slipping back into my diet.

title: Super loving it!
body: Love taking the pics of what I eat and how it records the time for me. I can go into details about how I felt about this meal, or simply indicate whether it was “on path” or “off path.” Also love how you can state what your goals are from the beginning. Thanks for making this app!

title: Giving it a whirl!
body: I am happy to try this app as a way to track and be mindful of why I eat - is it actual physical hunger, or some emotional reason? I love the “path” idea. One suggestion: consider adding a way to categorize each episode of eating as a “Meal” or “Snack.”  (Would perhaps help user be more aware of snacking tendencies)

title: Just what I needed
body: I’m trying to get back into tracking and this was exactly what I was looking for - a binary way of seeing how well I’m sticking to my goals (80% on path is my current one).

title: Easy and keeps you accountable.
body: My trainer showed me this app and I love it!  Seeing pictures of what you’ve eaten is way more effective than just reading words.  It is really easy to use and I’m very happy with it and will continue to use it for the foreseeable future.

title: Best Food Journalling App!
body: We all do our best dieting when we keep track of what goes in our mouths. This is awesome. No counting calories. Keeps track of on plan or off plan and the feelings around eating. This is the way to lose the weight for good. This app is perfectly aligned with PhitNPhat podcasts. It’s the secret!

title: Just what I was looking for!
body: This app provides a great way for me to hold myself accountable without the stress of counting calories. It is quick and easy with the ability to connect with others and share your plans with your friends. I’m loving this app!

title: Easy to use and informative
body: I have used many tracking apps but felt I was always tied to my phone. With ATE I am able to set my own goals, snap a photo, and be done. It’s easy to look back on a day or a week and see where I strayed from my goals.

title: Awesome visual food diary
body: Great way to visually document your daily meal journey. It will not assess calories or nutrients per meal, rather provides a simple way to assess patterns regarding where you eat, who you eat with, and how you feel after each meal - al important factors to maintaining your desired nutritional path.

title: Best food log app ever
body: I love how simple and straightforward it is, and it doesn’t make me count calories (which my nutritionist advised me NOT to do). I actually look forward to recording my meals. I also love how it lets me write the reason I’m eating as a reminder, which is to fuel my body, in my case.

title: Looks great but needs a better method to share
body: As with many apps that have a sharing capability, Ate requires the other person to have the app and pay the premium price. I have a food coach of sorts and he works with several people. I can’t make him pick an app. Need to be able to do a simple export report of some sort. So cancelling my premium same day I bought it.

title: Great way to bring mindfulness to your eating
body: Totally love this app. I feel like I have found a new way to think about what I put in my plate. I find myself thinking about balance, color, and presentation of the food. Plus it’s so easy to just snap a pic and go!

title: A different sort of food tracker
body: This app helps with something that other apps have missed... addressing WHY we eat.  It really makes me think about why I’m putting good into my mouth, now, this way, in this place, which lets me correct lifestyle impacts on my diet.

title: Yes please and thank you.
body: I've tried food logging by writing down everything. Although insightful, it became more laborious and eventually I would stop. This works for me. Typically I'm on the run and I'm not here to count calories but to be completely mindful of what I'm consuming! Love this app!

title: Great food tracking app
body: I love this app because I don’t like to always write my food down but I do want to track it. I love being able to take pics of what I eat. It’s also easier to repeat that meal again if I can just see it. I’m a visual person.

title: Great Meal Photo Tracking App
body: For people like me who simply want to be accountable for what we eat and keep track of it visually without having to count calories, this is a great little App. It’s simple and takes very little time to use. I’m pleased with it thus far!

title: Love it!
body: It’s great to be able to track what I’m eating, why I’m eating it and how it makes me feel without counting calories or macros. Carrying a written food journal just isn’t practical for me so this app is super convenient since I always have my phone.

title: Awesome App!!!
body: Not only does it give you a recap of your day, you can choose only pics, include notes, or include your “goals.” I love including my notes, which helps describe things you may not “see” in the photo, such as collagen or veggies added to shakes!!!

title: Started using it today and already love it!!
body: I may be biased because I’m an engineer but the grãos has options are totally on point! The app already registers the times and dates of the pictures, and focus on the food experience, not quantities and calories!! I love it already!!

title: The right path
body: After years of using a calorie counting app, I know what I should eat and how many calories I have to work with. The missing piece was identifying why I was eating, and if it was on path of my goal. This app does exactly that, and quickly. Well done!

title: LOVE this!
body: I’m never going to be someone who cares to track my macros/nutritional details regularly. I have accepted this. So apps that track that don’t work for me.

title: So easy!
body: Love this app! So easy to use. The only thing I wish it would do is let me go back to the day before if I remember the next morning that I forgot to put in something I ate. It seems that once the day is passed I can’t change it.

title: GREAT app
body: I Love this app!! It’s so much easier than counting calories and I’ve already seen a lot better results since using this. It’s simple and easy to use. Plus, the visual presentation of what you eat in a given day really helps put things into perspective.

title: AMAZING!!!
body: I swore off food logging forever until I found this little gem!! It truly makes you think about what you put into your mouth and I LOVE that it shows hours fasted and time between meals! I’ve lost 8 pounds in 5 weeks!! Thank you for creating this app!!!

title: Simple app, great idea
body: I really like how simple this app is to use. It’s a great and easy way to keep a food diary for people who don’t want to track calories. I like how I can put in text if i forget to take pictures. I wish I could track exercises in the app as well though. I really like how the app focuses on mindful eating too!

title: Fantastic!
body: I have nothing negative to say about Ate. There are a few things I’d personally change in regards to the layout but that is personal preference. I love this app so much I’m talking my nutritionist into using it as a coach. I would highly recommend!

title: Perfect solution
body: I belong to Phit N Phat and in PnP we do not track calories, you learn to listen to hunger cues and practice mindful eating. I absolutely LOVE that because there are no food restrictions and the lessons you learn and the mindset change is easily sustainable for life. This app blends in PERFECTLY with what we learn and I absolutely love it!

title: Glad to have heard of!
body: Listened to podcast and called mentioned your app.

title: Great app for keeping a good journal on the go !!❤️
body: I’m terrible at writing things down and I hate looking things up to record a food journal ! My nutrition coach Recommed the ATE app to have a visual accountability of food journaling!! So easy  even when your busy  , pictures are with a thousand words !!

title: Very helpful
body: Its good to have an image at the end of the day of what come in your mouth , i just wish that the developer add same path for habits so you can have an overall evaluation of your habits either good or bad .
