Its good to have something simple like this without any complication just use ur cam record and go .

title: Option of free?
body: It is so good. However, I was wondering if there could be a free option where we can take pictures of our food without paying for a subscription? I don’t mind viewing ads

title: No Counting
body: My daughter and I were looking for a weight reduction program with no counting.  This app is it.  In about ten days I lost two pounds by documenting my food consumption in photos.  It asks questions that are useful and it is helping me identify foods that don’t agree with me too.

title: Awesome way to track food
body: I love this app! The challenges are great, it’s easy to use and the data is so eye opening. It’s so interesting to see all the patterns. Highly recommend to anyone looking to examine data and change up food habits. Adding an option for snacks AND meals would make this 5 stars!

title: Easy peasy
body: This is a great for those who don’t want to diet but just need a little motivation to eat the way they know they should. It’s easy to use and it’s no pressure. Just snap a photo of your food or type it in and say if you’re on the path you’ve chosen or not.

title: Exactly what I was looking for
body: Didn’t want to track calories but needed a way to track what I eat. Love the feature to type in what you didn’t get to snap. I think I may try some of the other features I found next.

title: Doesn’t Make Me Feel Bad
body: This app is great! I’ve tried others and I always end up feeling defeated and sad. Then I just eat more. This app is free of judgement, is visual, and lets me set my own attainable goals. This is exactly what everyone needs to start a healthy lifestyle, not a diet. Love it!

title: Finally
body: This is something I’ve been wanting for a long time. It’s not only beneficial for me, but also for my patients that have to follow strict diets. Everyone has a phone these days, and it’s so simple to just snap a pic right before you eat.

title: Just what I needed
body: Awesome and easy way to track my feelings regarding the food I eat! I think this app will actually help me to achieve my goals versus ones where I only focused on the calorie content in food, not how it was making me and my body feel.

title: Really Love it
body: I found this app through Corrine Crabtree and her PNPTribe! Makes tracking my food so easy, I tell myself at the end of the day to record buuuuut in reality I’m chasing 3 kids around all day and you’re lucky if I can find the darn car keys. This makes it easy and humbling 🙌🏻

title: So good
body: This app has truly helped me fall back in love with food and I’m so grateful. Been telling all of my friends who have struggled with food and we are having a great time being aware of what we are consuming. No numbers, no obsessions just healthy choices.

title: Simply the best
body: Easy tracking for the person who wants to be more aware of what and when they eat. Time stamped pics also track frequency of meals and fasting periods. I no longer have to use a separate fasting app. This is very useful!

title: Just what I wanted
body: I was looking for an app to support my Intuitive Eating journey. This app answered the call. I was able to customize with my own follow up questions. It makes tracking so easy. Highly recommend.

title: Best food tracking app!
body: I love this app! It is so easy and intuitive, and the ability to connect with my family has helped us all stay accountable and motivated. Hands down the best food tracker I’ve ever used. Highly recommend!

title: So simple to use!
body: I love how straight-forward this app is. Just take a pic of what you eat, and decide if it’s on track or not. It’s really helped me make better food choices just because I have committed to tracking with the app. Thanks for a great app!

title: Not just a food tracker!
body: This app is exactly what I needed to not only track my food but to focus on mindful eating. I am able to track why and where I ate to consider my emotions and environmental influences. Super easy to use. I would highly recommend it!

title: Food app of my dreams!
body: FINALLY - an app that doesn’t overcomplicate my needs. When I record my food, all I want is to record: What I ate, when I ate it, How I FELT when I ate it, and how I felt after. I’ve gone down calorie, macro, portion journeys before — but this is THE APP for intuitive eating.

title: Great way to practice mindful eating and visualize!

body: I guess if you just want to take pictures of your food on a daily basis, it’s fine. But to actually be useful it needs more... granted, some of this would be available with the paid version, but it seems like pretty basic stuff to be paying for, and I would much prefer an ads vs no ads payment structure. A few ways this could be more useful... being able to add keywords to photos would be extremely useful. For instance, being able to add the keyword “impulse” or “cheat” to a photo and over time be able to pull up all the photos tagged this way would be extremely useful. Likewise, the keyword for a certain type of food could easily bring up a meal that had been forgotten. I suppose it would be possible to achieve this round-about by using the question & answer format they have, if you purchase the premium version with the ability to make your own. Having the water tracking only available in premium is also a huge negative for me as it is so important to healthy eating and weight loss. Also a place to track sleep would be beneficial. I tried adding a photo already on my phone, but it cuts off half the photo, which makes this feature pretty useless. Also, one of the dashboard metrics is about working toward your goal, but there is nowhere to set a goal. I had such high hopes for this app as a comprehensive tool and tracker, just with photos instead of listing out everything I ate, but am super disappointed that it came nowhere close to that. It’s just a glorified photo gallery... certainly no more robust than just keeping a photo log in Google or Instagram.

title: Best food logging app ever
body: I've been logging my food for about 2 years now, and this is the best method I've ever used. For over a year, I logged all my calories and macros with apps like my fitness pal, Fitbit, cronometer, and a few others. I never really enjoyed logging food that way. Eventually I realized that I had gained enough intuition about the nutrients of my food that I no longer needed to track macros to reach my goals, but I still wanted to log to keep me mindful of the way I ate. I tried at least 3 other picture logging apps, a written journal where I described my meals, and a photo journal without an app. This is far better than any other thing I tried for a few reasons: 1. It only takes two taps to log a meal. This allows you to actually enjoy your eating rather than try to count every calorie and macro/micro nutrient 2. It is easy to visualize your day of eating 3. The simple reflection options for the meals are helping me to evaluate my eating in a more holistic way, rather than just looking at nutritional content 4. Great for intermittent fasting 5. The interface is very ascetically pleasing and intuitive. I really love the simplicity of on/off path, however, if you've never logged your food before and your goal is weight/fat loss, I'd suggest tracking calories/macros for at least a few days so that you can have a more educated idea of what's on/off path for you.

body: I love this app, it is no-nonsense, user-friendly.  It makes it super easy for me to journal my meals- snap a pic, and I instantly have what and when I've eaten all day. title: Easy to use consistently

title: Easy, User-Friendly, Intuitive, and Fast
body: I don't usually take the time to leave reviews for apps but I feel this app really deserves it. Not only is the app really easy to use with a user-friendly interface and intuitive design, the creators are really easy to reach with questions and suggestions. I received a reply within hours on a Sunday, even when it said they wouldn't reply until Monday. The reply was friendly, professional, and addressed my suggestion. The app has thought of a lot of things that you would like to have in a journaling app, such as why you're eating, where you're eating, and how you feel after eating it. The best part is, these are all optional, or easily added later, if you are pressed for time. I highly recommend this app for those who are looking to find trends in their eating patterns but who don't want to enter each and every ingredient or count calories.

title: A Handy, Easy Way to Track your Food
body: 7/29/17 Update: It's been almost two months now since I've had the app.  I am raising my rating to a 5 star because 1. I see now how the app helps me to be fully transparent with my eating habbits without any guilt in my recording what I am tracking.  In a very useful way it helps me to honestly confront my behavior and then I can look at how I feel, times of day and make modifications to that behavior with some self descipline.   One thing that I do have challenges with is the apps ability to update my iPad and iPhone with new entries.  I have found there to be a signifcant lag time, sometimes several days without an update of the meals I have recorded on one being shown on the other.  I spoke with the team and they are going to address this wth one of the future updates.  I still believe this is worthy of 5 stars and has proven to be the type of food tracking took that is easy to use and one that I will continue to use.  Oh, by the way my conversation with the tech support people was very plesant and they genuinely seemed interested in my concerns.  That is a big plus as well.
